description: The Waterfront Place Hotel and the Morgantown Event Center features state of the art design and engineering with multi-purpose accommodations for regional, national and international meetings, tradeshows, theatrical and other special events. The mission of the Morgantown Event Center is to enhance the economic fabric and quality of life of the city of Morgantown by: *Marketing the city as a national destination for national,regional and statewide conventions and meetings. *Working harmoniously with other organizations involved in marketing and promoting the City of Morgantown and assisting in our goal of enabling Morgantown and its immediate environment to become a regional family‐oriented arts,cultural, education,sports and entertainment center that will create new jobs and broaden the tourism effort. *Servicing the needs of all visiting groups and individuals and providing visitors with a Morgantown experience that exceeds expectations. The Morgantown Event/Conference Center is centrally located in the Wharf District of the Downtown Morgantown area and is uniquely situated to be within walking distance of the main campus of West Virginia University. For an additional convenience, the center is adjacent to the Caperton Walking Trail which serves as a 10 minute walking trail to local restaurants and 15 minutes to an additional tiered parking garage for guests.

The Morgantown Farmers' Market is a producer-only market featuring fresh fruits and vegetables, free-range eggs and meat, honey, herbs, bedding plants, brick oven breads, and much more. Open Saturdays 8:30 a.m. - noon from May thru October. Located in the parking lot at Spruce and Fayette Streets in downtown Morgantown.

Step back into the colorful history of Morgantown with the self-guided Historic Downtown Morgantown Audio Walking Tour. Learn about our town’s legacy via a look at the distinctive, classic architectural styles that inhabit our downtown, and learn how they were shaped and modified by Morgantown’s rich history and famous personages that built a thriving community along the banks of the Monongahela River. Pick up your Audio Walking Tour guidebook at the Main Street Morgantown Office, 201 High St. 1st floor. Call 304-292-0168 for information or reservations.

description: The small railroading town of Grafton was the birthplace of Mother's Day, founded by Miss Anna Jarvis in honor of her mother. The first observed Mother's Day was May 10, 1908 at Andrews Methodist Episcopal Church. This historic building erected in 1873, is situated at 11 E. Main Street, and now serves as a monument/museum to Mother's Day, and is a registered historic landmark. The International Mother's Day Shrine is a 146-year-old landmark of Grafton and is one of the sixteen national historic landmarks in West Virginia. On December 18, 1970, the shrine was named a National Historic Place, and on October 5, 1992, it was added to the National Historic Landmark registry. Then, on June 30, 2007, it was noted as a National United Methodist Historic Site. Open May - October, Tuesday - Saturday, 10am - 4pm. Group tours are welcome with advance arrangements. To schedule a tour or request further information, call 304-265-1589. For information on the National Historic Landmark program, contact the Historic Preservation Office at 304-558-0220.
address: 11 E Main St, Grafton, WV 26354, USA

description: Although the Mothman Legacy began nearly 40 years ago, it still has a strong hold on the small community of Point Pleasant and the thousands of townspeople and visitors who have hunted for him. Does he exist? Where did he come from? What really happened? Come and participate in guided tours of the areas where he was seen and hear the stories of eyewitness accounts and strange occurrences.
address: 400 Main St, Point Pleasant, WV 25550, USA

description: Mothman Harley-Davidson is the Mid-Ohio Valley’s exclusive authorized Harley-Davidson dealership. They have the diagnostic equipment and factory trained technicians necessary to keep your Harley-Davidson in top condition. Great selection of bikes, trikes, accessories and motor clothes!

See the largest collection of props and memorabilia from the movie "The Mothman Prophecies"--in the town where the Mothman sightings and encounters actually occurred. Read rare historical documents from the Mothman eyewitnesses themselves, documenting what they experienced that fateful night on November 15, 1966. See rare historical press clippings and photographs of the Silver Bridge disaster. Learn more about the historical figureheads of the Mothman legacy like John Keel, Mary Hyre, & the Scarberry & Mallete eyewitnesses. There is plenty here to be discovered. Research and uncover the truth for yourself. The Mothman Museum is the worldâ€™s only museum/research center devoted to the West Virginia legend called Mothman. Movie props, archives and rare collectible items are on display. We are located just off of interstate 35, less than 1 mile from the Point Pleasant exit. Admission: Adults/$4; Kids 10 & under/$1 *We accept VISA/MC & Cash*
address: 400 Main St, Point Pleasant, WV 25550, USA

description: The large monument was erected by the Daughters of the Confederacy in 1908. On historic Mt. Isner rests at least 33 Confederate dead killed in the Battle of Rich Mountain. The small cemetery rests on a hill overlooking historic Beverly, West Virginia. It is surrounded by a rock and iron fence and includes an obelisk over 20 feet in height. The cemetery is surrounded by Union fortifications. Many of the trenches are still visible. NOTICE: THIS SITE IS ON PRIVATE PROPERTY: If you wish to visit the cemetery, please inquire at the Visitor Center about access. Heritage Center Hours: Sunday – Thursday: 11am - 5pm Friday & Saturday: 10am - 6pm Closed Major Holiday

Mountain Craft Shop Co. is in it's 55th year of the most fun business. Come and play with fun toys from the past. Our products, collectively known as American Folk Toys, are reproductions of toys once made at home and handed down from one generation to another. Most of our toys are made of native hardwoods, such as poplar, walnut, cherry, beech, or maple. The toy names may sound strange like our WhimmyDiddle and FlipperDinger, but they are the traditional names from years past. We also use local products such as the marbles in many of our items (Musical Marble Tree, Marble Chute, TicTacToe) are made in Paden City, WV at the Marble King factory. Marble King is one of the last remaining marble factories in North America. At our woodshop, folks can see us take logs and twigs and change them into toys. The shop is in the old Grandview School, now home of ThistleDew Farm, where you can also shop for honey and beeswax products. Both educational and fun, this is an excellent family adventure and experience! We are open Monday through Friday, 9 to 4, and some weekends from Noon to 3pm. Please visit, but do call ahead.
address: 7901 Proctor Creek Rd, Proctor, WV 26055, USA

description: All eight cabins are fully furnished with everything you need for an overnight stay or an extended vacation. Imagine a cozy log cabin in the heart of West Virginia's majestic mountains, where you will awaken to romantic misty mornings, accompanied by a soft symphony of birds and a mountain stream. Here at Mountain Creek Cabins, our rustic cabins provide a romantic getaway for you and your significant other. Located in the mountains of West Virginia, most of our cabins include a hot tub and other special features. Take a look at our cabins that are located in both Cheat Lake, West Virginia and in Canaan Valley, West Virginia. All Mountain Creek Cabins at the Cheat Lake location are facing the woods, have a back deck, and include a hot tub that offer picturesque views. Some hot tubs are covered while others are open air. The Winterset 12 Starry Nights vacation home in Canaan Valley has a private outdoor hot tub and spacious sleeping quarters. This vacation home is in walking distance of the Timberline Resort and sleeps up to twelve for the ideal family getaway. Other properties include the Peaceful Getaway Cabin and the Rest Assured Cabin that reside in a luxury resort. Both cabins are great for a couple’s getaway and offer access to a heated swimming pool. Located near Coopers Rock State Forest and only 25 minutes from Morgantown. Mountain Creek Cabins are a perfect place for you and your family to cheer on the Mountaineers and relax in your own mountain getaway

description: Can you imagine yourself relaxing on the banks of beautiful Summersville Lake while your kids are playing making new friends? Then we invite you to choose from one of our yurts, lakefront campsites or cabins, which is the only lakefront lodging offered on Summersville Lake. We are conveniently located in the Gauley Recreational area and on the banks of Summersville Lake on Airport Road beside the marina. We have exactly what you are looking for whether you want to be nestled between the trees with privacy or right on the shoreline with your boat tied up by your site. If you’re looking for something to keep you busy then don’t worry! There is plenty to do right at the campground. Don't forget to bring your four-legged family member too because, our campsites are pet friendly - just be sure to read our pet policy first. If you don’t feel like cooking, no problem! Come enjoy a wonderful meal at our restaurant then pick up a dessert from our snack bar located in our uniquely filled gift shop. We also have an annual Haunted Trail that is sure to be frightfully good! There is also plenty to choose from within a short distance drive from us such as horseback riding, rafting, boat rentals, scuba diving and snorkeling, fishing, rock climbing, hiking and biking, just ask one of our friendly staff members and they will be glad to help you in finding surrounding activities.

company: Mountain State Brewing Company - Thomas, WV
description: At over 3,000 ft. in elevation, Mountain State Brewing Co. sits at the top of the watershed, allowing beer to be brewed with the purest water possible. Starting with just a 3-barrel brew system, the brewhouse quickly needed to expand to more than double that capacity to meet increasing demand. Since then they’ve established one of the largest microbrewery distribution footprints in the state of West Virginia. Attached to the Thomas brew house is Mountain State Brewing Co.’s tap room and music hall. Seasonal kitchen offerings, brewery tours, a live music & events schedule and the freshest brews available make MSBC a destination stop for locals and travelers alike. Mountain State Brewing Co. currently brews four flagship ales year round that are readily available for tasting in the tap room during pub hours, as well as growler sales to go.

The Mountain State Forest Festival is one of the largest and oldest festivals in West Virginia. The festival affords us the opportunity to share with our community and state the important role West Virginia’s natural resources play in our economic development. Rich in tradition, the festival also plays a major role in our local and state economy and offers something for everyone to enjoy, such as, headline concerts and music shows, lumberjack competition, forestry & wood exhibits, juried art show, photography exhibit, quilt show, arts and crafts, amusement rides, (3) parades and the Royal Coronation of Queen Silvia.

description: 18 fun and challenging holes of miniature golf that explore unique features of life and history in West Virginia - you'll golf over the New River Gorge Bridge, visit an old-timey out house, hurry past the glowing eyes of the spooky Mothman, and even navigate the twists and turns of the outrageous par 5 West Virginia Turnpike! Learn a little about the Mountain State while having a great time with family and friends. Also visit the Outside-In Climbing Gym & Chocolate Moose Coffee Shop.

Childhood friends were drafted into their country's service and only one made it home. A graveside promise was made that'll never let anyone forget you guys. Ron McVaney vowed to keep his promise. With the help of the LCBOE, Lewis County Commission and the public, the Mountaineer Military Museum is a reality.

description: Mountwood Park is a county park located 12 miles east of Parkersburg, West Virginia on US Route 50. The park contains over 50 miles of hiking, biking, and horseback riding trails, campgrounds, a 50-acre lake and wooded picnic areas. Mountwood Park Family Campground offers 87 campsites suitable for tents, trailers and recreational vehicles. The campground has 16 full hookup sites, 64 sites with electric/water and 7 primitive sites. Each site has a picnic table and fire ring. Multiple bathhouses are located throughout the campground offering hot showers and clean restroom facilities. Firewood, ice, souvenirs and camping supplies are available from the campground host while on duty. Families can enjoy a variety of campground activities throughout the season. A playground and New Nature Trail are also available for registered campers. Want to go camping but not in a tent? Try one of Mountwood’s Primitive Cabins located in Mountwood Family Campground. Each cabin comes equipped with electric, two sets of bunk beds, ceiling fans/lights and a table with four chairs. Each Primitive Cabin has a fire ring and a charcoal grill and is located near the bathhouse and playground. Maximum occupancy is four people. Mountwood Park has a beautiful lakeside house with two units available for lodging. This pristine lakeside house is located along the shore of Mountwood Lake. Each unit has one bedroom with a queen bed and a sleeper sofa in the living room, sleeping a total of four people. The units are completely equipped for housekeeping with cooking utensils, dishes, linens, blankets, kitchens with modern appliances, and baths with built in shower/tub units. Guests need only to supply food and personal items. Unit #1 has a large built-on deck perfect for any family barbecue outing. Both units have central air and heating, making them a perfect place to enjoy a vacation getaway close to home. Maximum occupancy is up to six people in each unit. Also enjoy the boat dock with canoe and kayak rentals–The 50-acre lake is stocked during the winter months by the DNR with trout. The lake also has catfish, large-mouth bass, crappie, carp, sun fish, baitfish, muskie and crayfish; games area, shelters, 20 miles of hiking and mountain biking trail–These trails are also open year round, and offer four seasons of riding enjoyment through scenic, rocky woodlands and the historic ruins of the nineteenth-century oil community of Volcano; picnicking, birding, mini-golf course, 18 hole disc golf course and public shooting range.
address: Borland Springs Rd, Waverly, WV 26184, USA

description: Mt. Tabor Baptist Church is located at the corner of Court and Foster Streets in Lewisburg. The church traces its roots back to the 1780s, being among the oldest Baptist units established in what is now Southern West Virginia. The present building dates from 1832. Of special interest in the evolution of Mt. Tabor, is its transfer from a white to black congregation after the Civil War. Such transfers were not uncommon. But the decision in a court of law that blacks were the rightful successors to the continuation of the old body of trustees was not only an exceptional method of transfer but also an unusual decision. On the National Register of Historic Places.
address: 203 W Foster St, Lewisburg, WV 24901, USA

description: Having a “home base” to come back to after a day of West Virginia outdoor adventure is important, which is why we offer convenient on-site lodging options that include brand-new guest rooms, the Yellow House Inn vacation house, rustic cabins, and tent camping. We’re sure to have the lodging type that fit the needs of your adventure! Our simple yet cozy motel-style Guest Rooms can accommodate up to 4 people and include a full bathroom as well as access to wireless internet and to our Guest Lounge downstairs. The Guest Rooms are climate-controlled and feature a full-size bed and a twin bunk-bed (linens are provided). The Guest Lounge includes a Wi-Fi TV, sitting areas, coffee, snacks, and more. Please note all Guest Rooms are non-smoking and do not allow pets. Camping: Our tent camping area is perfect for groups and individuals alike and is conveniently located just a short walk from the Welcome Center. The tent camping area is equipped with a fire pit per campsite as well as a latrine. Drinking water provided. ** Cut firewood is available for purchase. To prevent the spread of invasive insects and diseases, please do not bring firewood in from other locations. The Yellow House Inn is a lovely 3-bedroom vacation house with all the amenities you need in a home away from home and is perfect for families and groups. The YHI is climate-controlled and has a fully-equipped kitchen, wireless internet, and cable TV. It sleeps up to 12 people in three bunk beds and two full-size beds (linen and towels are provided). Please note that the Yellow House Inn is non-smoking and does not allow pets. Cabins: Our four rustic Mountainside Cabins are the perfect location for a quiet, peaceful, and simple getaway from the distractions of everyday life. Simple duplex, one room cabins equipped with bunk beds and solar lighting with access to our new bath house complete with hot showers, toilets, and a screened-in kitchen/porch area (for cabin guests only). A designated community fire pit and charcoal grill are available for cabin guests as well. Cabins sleep 6 people via 3 sets of bunk beds on each side. The Bath House is open from late spring to early fall. When the Bath House is closed a porta-john is available but showers are not. Fires are permitted in designated fire rings only. Cut firewood is available for purchase. To prevent the spread of invasive insects and diseases, please do not bring firewood in from other locations. The road to the cabin area is a steep gravel driveway. We highly recommend a 4×4 or high clearance vehicle **You’ll need to bring your own linens (sleeping bag, pillow, etc) Solar lighting, NO ELECTRICITY Potable water is provided

description: The National Coal Heritage Area (NCHA) is one of only 40 nationally designated heritage areas in the entire United States. It represents a part of the growing effort by the National Park Service to develop resource protection initiatives for areas of national importance that rely on partnerships and private ownership rather than the traditional methods of Federally owned parklands. The mission of the National Coal Heritage Area is to preserve, protect, and interpret lands, structures and communities associated with the coal mining heritage of West Virginia. This area is a destination worth visiting during the wintertime.

description: Nellis Historic District is a national historic district located at Nellis, Boone County, West Virginia. It encompasses 82 contributing buildings, three contributing structures, and one contributing object. The district includes the commercial, ecclesiastical, and residential buildings built by the Nellis Coal Company as a planned community between 1920 and 1955. The community was a model for coal communities in Boone County and the southern coal fields. Included in the district is the Nellis Church / Nellis Archives (1926), stone wall constructed by the Works Progress Administration (c. 1935), coal company storage building (c. 1945), Nellis Company Store and Offices (1922), community bulletin board (c. 1921), Superintendent's House (c. 1925), and clubhouse (c. 1925).[2] Nellis was named by mine owners Matthew Slush and T.E.B. Siler after Frank E. Nellis, editor of the "Mount Clemens Independent" in Michigan. It was listed on the National Register of Historic Places in 2000.[1]

description: The New Era School was built in 1884 and served students in grades 1 through 8 until 1956. The facility then served as a community building for the Missouri Run area. It was later turned over to the Wood County Association of Retired School Employees. In 1991, the Living Heritage Museum Project, a newly formed volunteer organization, acquired the building for restoration. The building was dismantled and moved 7 miles from Missouri Run to the Mineral Wells School campus for reconstruction. The New Era School has maintained the integrity of its time with original desks, pot-bellied stove, slate chalkboards, oiled floors, pump, outhouse, and coal shed. Additional items make the schoolroom appear ready for Reading, 'Riting, and 'Rithmetic. New Era School Museum welcomes visitors of all ages. Come experience school in the way of the early 1900's. Informed docents will host your visit. Open by request also (e-mail) esthercarroll@casinternet.net

"TWO-WHEEL FRIENDLY LODGING IN THE MONONGAHELA NATIONAL FOREST" The Old Clark Inn has a 1920's ambiance with the amenities and comfort of a modern hotel. Located within walking distance to restaurants, shops and a tavern, we are a two-wheel friendly establishment with special amenities for motorcyclists and bicyclists alike. Snowshoe Resort is 22-miles north of town. The Old Clark Inn is located in downtown Marlinton, West Virginia, in Pocahontas County. Marlinton is a MON Forest town situated in the Monongahela National Forest. There are nearby state parks and miles of mountain roads perfect for motorcycles. The Greenbrier River Trail is one-block from the inn and provides a 78-mile scenic bike trail that traverses along the Greenbrier River. Restaurants, shops and a tavern are within walking distance from the inn, allowing guests on two-wheels to park after their ride and walk around town. Skiers and snowboarders can enjoy the convenience of staying in town and avoid the crowds and expense of Snowshoe Resort.

description: Formally set aside as a cemetery in 1851, the shelling of Moorefield took place from this hillside in 1863. A section of the cemetery is noted on a map as “Confederate dead,” and features a large monument, which was erected by the Memorial Association in 1873. The obelisk has plaques on each of the four sides recognizing the McNeill Rangers, Hardy Blues and Grays and the 18th and 7th Virginia Cavalries. The monument stands in the center of a double ring of gravestones. Moorefield, W.Va.

description: Orr’s Farm Market is a family-owned farm market and orchard located in Martinsburg, West Virginia. Operating year-round, the business sells local retail items, baked goods, and produce. Otter Cafe serves coffee, tea, latte, cappuccino, espresso, and smoothies.

Sip, savor and indulge. Experience the essence of West Virginia at the Oxley House. Located in the historic Tygart Hotel in Elkins, our restaurant showcases the best of Appalachian cuisine. Indulge in elevated dining while immersing yourself in the flavors of the region. The Oxley House has some of the finest food and drink Elkins has to offer. From casual fine dining, specialty cocktails and steakhouse classics to local craft beer and mouth-watering desserts, there is something to satisfy every appetite. Unwind on our outdoor patio. Relax at our full- service bar or if you prefer the privacy of your own room, enjoy a refreshing drink or bite to eat to go. Gather with friends and family for a memorable meal. Because whatever flavors you crave, you’ll find them at the Oxley House.

We are located along the banks of the Ohio River. Our beautiful location has public access to the Ohio River along with an enjoyable walking trail that covers the entire park. description: Panther State Forest, located on the border of West Virginia and Kentucky, is the state’s southernmost state forest. It occupies 7,810 rugged acres, and its heavily wooded surroundings offer a range of outdoor amenities like camping, hiking trails, scenic overlooks, fishing, picnicking, swimming and hunting. Panther State Forest gets its name from Panther Creek, a tributary of the Tug Fork where a pioneer reportedly killed a panther.

Located along U.S. Rt. 219, the Pearl S. Buck Birthplace was built by the Stulting Family who emigrated from Holland to America in 1847 and lived here on a sixteen acre farm. On June 26, 1892, Pearl Comfort Sydenstricker was born here. Writing under her married name of Pearl S. Buck, she won the hearts of Americans with her PULITZER PRIZE winning novel, THE GOOD EARTH. She is the first American woman to ever receive both the Pulitzer Prize and Nobel Prize for Literature.

company: Plum Orchard Lake Wildlife Management Area
description: The 2,953-acre Plum Orchard Lake Wildlife Management Area is located 5 miles north of Pax in Fayette County. It is accessible from Pax and Mossy via County Routes 23 and 23/1. Camping permit required from area manager. Plum Orchard Lake provides an excellent warmwater fishery for largemouth bass, bluegill, crappie, and channel catfish. It is one of the top producers of trophy size largemouth bass, bluegill, and channel catfish in the state. Large bluegill are abundant and can be caught easily on worms and small spinners. Fishing for channel catfish has been excellent after dark using natural baits. Largemouth bass are taken as early as the end of March on spinners, deep-running lures, and worms. The lake often remains clear when most impoundments in the state are muddy.
address: 1156 Plum Orchard Lake Rd, Scarbro, WV 25917, USA

One of the most scenic spots along the South Branch, the Trough is home to American bald eagles. description: The Prickett's Fort Memorial Foundation operates the historic attractions at Prickett's Fort State Park including a museum gift shop, visitor center, orientation exhibit, and living history interpretation. Costumed staff give tours each day and demonstrate historic crafts and daily life from the late 1700's on the frontier of Virginia. In addition to the reconstructed fort, an 1950's brick home from the Prickett family is available for tour. It has been restored and is furnished with antiques.
address: 88 State Park Rd, Fairmont, WV 26554, USA

description: Prickett's Fort State Park is a 188-acre West Virginia state park north of Fairmont, W.Va. near the confluence of Prickett's Creek and the Monongahela River, and two miles from Interstate 79. The park features a reconstructed refuge fort and commemorates life on the Virginia frontier during the late 18th century. The original fort was constructed in 1774 to provide early settlers protection from Native American attacks. It was built within 10 miles of three major Indian trails. The fort was named after Capt. Jacob Prickett. In addition to the fort, the park also has an awesome visitors center, numerous events and activities, a boat launch, birding observation deck and is the trail head for the Mon River Trail. Pricketts Fort gift shop, orientation gallery and administrative offices are open year-round, Monday through Friday, 10 a.m. - 4 p.m.
address: 88 State Park Rd, Fairmont, WV 26554, USA

description: Exhibits of railroad artifacts, artworks, lanterns, books, photographs, the Virginian Caboose#308 built in 1949 and corporate railroad material from the Virginian and Norfolk-Southern Railroads. Whether you are patient in the care of Ruby Memorial Hospital, attending a WVU football game, or in town on business, guests benefit from a short commute, and the best hospitality in town from our friendly staff. Reed's Mill is a historic grist mill and national historic district located at Secondcreek, Monroe County, West Virginia. It was one of the original mill complexes of Secondcreek. The main mill building was built about 1791, and is a mortise and tenon frame structure held together with wooden pins, and sits atop a raised cut stone basement. A tall three-story section with basement was added in 1949. The district also includes the mill dam, wing-dam, mill race lined with rock and ending in the mill pond, and concrete mill race that carries water to the turbine (1872) which operates the grinding wheels in the mill. It remains an operating mill.
address: 1331 Second Creek Rd, Sinks Grove, WV 24976, USA

description: Our lodging accommodations are designed for all groups and tastes. Do you prefer a hotel room or suite, or your own multi-bedroom vacation rental spacious enough for the entire family? The lodging accommodations at our family resort in WV are casually elegant, and best of all – surprisingly affordable. You and your family will delight in our dining options. There are four restaurants and several lounges just steps away – ranging from a casual cafe, elegant special occasion dining, bountiful buffets, and a lively sports bar and restaurant. Championship golfing, spa services, and blissfully simple pursuits like swimming, hiking and boating are all at your doorstep. Bowl a game or two, catch a movie, test your wits in an escape room, or enjoy a priceless West Virginia sunset – without ever leaving the resort. Just outside our gates, a world of adventure awaits you, with world-class whitewater rafting, downhill skiing, rock climbing, and unforgettable fly-fishing an easy drive away.

company: Rich Mountain Battlefield Civil War Site & Visitor Center
description: Site of the July 1861 Civil War battle for control of the Staunton-Parkersburg Turnpike. This early union victory catapulted Gen. George McClellan to leadership of the union army and gave the north control of western Virginia leading it to eventual statehood. This site, five miles west of the town of Beverly, WV, features interpretive signs, walking/hiking tours and picnic area. The Beverly Heritage Center (located on Main St., Beverly) serves as the interpretive center for the site with "The 1st Campaign of the Civil War" exhibit and research facilities. Group and guided tours by appointment. The Battlefield is open year round from dawn to dusk. Visitor Center open is open daily in season and weekdays through the winter.
address: Rich Mountain Rd, Beverly, WV 26253, USA

company: Robert W. Craig Campground at Jennings Randolph Lake
description: Our campground is hosted by four full time park attendants and two volunteer hosts that are dedicated to make your stay with us at the Robert W. Craig Campground as enjoyable as possible. This family oriented campground is spaciously located on the hills above the lake. The campground has 68 campsites, all of which have electrical services. The facility has hot showers, water hydrants every third or fourth site, and flush toilets at the washhouse and in the back loop comfort station. The campground also features a playground for children, campground store, horseshoe pits, and an amphitheater for evening programs presented by the ranger staff on Saturday nights. A large group picnic shelter with electricity, potable water, a full basketball court and horseshoe pits is also available. A public pay phone is located at the washhouse. Pets are permitted anywhere in the campground, except in the restroom facilities, however, they must be physically restrained at all times by either being in a pet cage or on a leash no more than six feet long. Properly dispose of your pets waste while camping and before leaving.

description: We are a family owned business who grows our own beautiful flowers and believes in supporting our local community of farmers and artisans! When we decided to expand our greenhouse and garden center to create a quality foods marketplace, we knew we couldn’t settle for anything less than the uncompromising quality that has been a hallmark of the Scots name for more than 30 years. So, we set out to harvest the freshest vegetables and fruits from local and regional farms, unique, hard-to-find specialty items, and quality packaged foods from names not only praised for their deliciousness, but also for the quality of their ingredients. Our standards are high. Each time you visit Scots Marketplace, you’ll discover a harvest of fresh produce and a growing lineup of delicious, quality foods. Visit our 1890 grist mill and enjoy our unique gift items, everything for your lawn and garden, plus a visit to "The Sugar Grove" for hand dipped ice cream.

description: Seneca Rocks, located in Monongahela National Forest, is one of the best-known landmarks in West Virginia and have long been noted as a scenic attraction and are popular with rock climbers. The rocks are a magnificent formation rising nearly 900 feet above the North Fork River. Eastern West Virginia contains many such formations of the white/gray Tuscarora quartzite. Seneca Rocks and nearby Champe Rocks are among the most imposing examples. A self-guided 1.3 mile interpretive trail beginning behind the Seneca Rocks Discovery Center offers the non-climber a way to reach the lofty heights of the rocks and view the scenic valley below.

Seneca Rocks Climbing School has been offering climbing instruction since 1971 and is the oldest continuously operated climbing school in the Mid-Atlantic. Whether you're just starting out or have been climbing for many years, Seneca Rocks Climbing School will make you a better and safer climber. Come discover the SRCS difference in climbing instruction. Register Online to Climb Seneca Rocks!
address: 27 Allegheny Dr suite b, Seneca Rocks, WV 26884, USA

description: Teaching programs – all technical equipment provided. Indoor climbing gym and training facility on-site. Children’s, women’s only and group programs available. Seasons: Summer (April 1 to Oct. 31). At Seneca Rocks.

description: Oldest of West Virginia's state forests, Seneca borders the beautiful Greenbrier River in Pocahontas County. The main attraction of the forest is the 65-foot Thorny Mountain Fire Tower, which was recently highlighted by National Geographic. The forest offers pioneer guest cabins; a four acre lake for trout, bass and bluegill fishing; a small campground and 11,684 acres of lush woodlands for hiking, hunting or communing with nature. The forest features Pioneer Cabins, opened for rental seasonally. Hiking, fishing, and quiet solitude are the hallmarks. The main attraction of the forest is the 65-foot Thorny Mountain Fire Tower. Come stay overnight in the secluded tower and take in the breathtaking sunsets with it's 360 degree views. The forest website includes rental rates, reservation information, trail information and more.
address: 10135 Browns Creek Rd, Dunmore, WV 24934, USA

company: Snow Sports Museum of West Virginia
description: A group of dedicated snow sports enthusiasts founded the Snows Sports Museum of West Virginia in 2018. The SSMWV preserves and documents West Virginia’s copious Snow Sports History. While West Virginians have always embraced winter and winter activities, the first ski area south of the Mason-Dixon Line was founded in 1951 by the Ski Club of Washington DC. The Ski Club opened Driftland near present-day Canaan Valley Resort, bringing snow sports to the Southeast. After Driftland opened, other resorts were established. A few resorts closed, but several are thriving, such as Blackwater Falls State Park, Canaan Valley Resort, Olegby Resort, Snowshoe, Winterplace, and White Grass. These resorts helped develop and continue to contribute to our thriving tourist industry. Visit the Snow Sports Museum in Davis, West Virginia – the state’s first ski town. The Museum features rotating exhibits honoring the state’s plethora of snow sports stories and legends.

Welcome to Snowshoe. Where sheer happiness is found on every slope, with every decadent four-course dinner and hot stone massage. A favorite destination among avid skiers and adventure-seeking snowmobiler, Snowshoe also makes a great warm weather retreats centered around hiking, mountain biking and horseback riding. Where boutique shopping, spa days and family fun convene often in glorious mountaintop memories. Make your next spring getaway at Snowshoe Mountain Resort. Book Now

Spruce Knob Mountain Center (SKMC) is a 400 acre high-elevation nature preserve located in the Potomac Highlands of West Virginia. The Potomac Highlands feature some of the darkest night skies in the Eastern U.S., the highest peak in the state (Spruce Knob), the healthiest streams in the state, extensive Red Spruce and northern hardwood forests, natural springs, and numerous caves. SKMC offers unique yurts for lodging accommodations. Camping at the Spruce Knob Mountain Center costs $15 per person, per night. This includes access to bathroom and shower facilities. Dormitory beds are available as well, for $25 a night. We also have three small, private guest yurts nestled up against the spruce forest for $60 per night apiece. With a minimum group of ten people, delicious home-cooked meals are available for an additional $30 per person, per day. Classroom and meeting space is available for a small additional fee.

description: The St. Albans Historical Society was founded in 1972 initially to move and preserve the 1846 log Morgan's Kitchen Museum to St. Albans. They have expanded greatly to promote an understanding of the history of St. Albans and to collect and preserve materials relating to the town's history, as well as to encourage the education of children about the town's history and to make these materials available to the public. The Society maintains a museum at 404 Fourth Ave., adjacent to the C&O Depot, with displays that include hundreds of vintage photos, books and artifacts. The rich archives there can be valuable for persons seeking family history or doing historical studies. This building is open every 1st Saturday of each month.

description: Old Stone House, also known as the Webster-Martin-Ireland House, is a historic inn and boarding house, located at Pennsboro, Ritchie County, West Virginia. The main section was built about 1810, and is a 22-story stone structure, five bays wide and two bays deep, with a gable roof. Attached to it is a two story frame addition with a hipped roof. It features a one story porch across the front facade. It is open by the Ritchie County Historical Society as a historic house and local history museum. It was listed on the National Register of Historic Places in 1978.
address: 310 W Myles Ave, Pennsboro, WV 26415, USA

Accommodations include a AAA Four Diamond Adirondack-style lodge, elegant saltbox-style cottages and lakeside campsites. All feature breathtaking views of the woods, water or the lush greens of the Arnold Palmer Signature golf course. On-site venues include a 15,000 sq. ft. conference center, full banquet facilities, spacious lakeside lawns, patios, ballrooms and three restaurants with distinct culinary personalities. Secluded but easily accessible, quiet yet invigorating, Stonewall Resort is the perfect place to meet, marry, celebrate, vacation and just get away.

description: Just 3 miles from I-79 and spanning 1,900 pristine acres, this vast and beautiful park is home to Stonewall Resort and its many amenities. Day guests and resort guests alike can enjoy this ideal setting for some of the state’s best bass and muskie fishing as well as kayaking, canoeing, paddle boarding, boating and more! Stonewall Resort State Park offers a variety of accommodations including scenic lakeside camping, a AAA Four Diamond Adirondack-style lodge and 10 lakeside cottages. Come explore 16+ miles of trails available for hiking or mountain biking, a 374-slip marina with boat launch & rentals, an 18-Hole Arnold Palmer Signature Golf Course with a full practice & teaching facility, state-of-the-art health & fitness facilities, a full-service spa, indoor/outdoor swimming pool and more!

description: In 1920, owner Merton A. Sybert opened the Strand Theatre. The Strand showed first-run films until its closure in 1968, and then again during a twenty-year period of operation from 1976 to 1996. In 2002, the nonprofit Strand Theatre Preservation Society was founded to restore and reopen the Strand as a performing arts venue. With the help of funding from the State Historic Preservation Office, the National Trust for Historic Preservation, and other sources, and with work from numerous volunteers, the long process began. Visit our Renovations page for more details on the renovation process!

The Strawberry Inn is a tiny piece of heaven. description: Taggart Hall was constructed in the 1790s by Frances Taggart (Tygart), a Quaker, on a lot at the corner of High Street and Gravel Lane laid out in the original Romney survey conducted in 1762 on behalf of Thomas Fairfax, 6th Lord Fairfax of Cameron. Taggart Hall was originally built as a clapboard "half-house". Taggart Hall is an excellent place to start a historic walking tour of Romney. The original eighteenth-century structure is owned by the Fort Mill Ridge Foundation. To schedule a tour of the Fort Mill Ridge Civil War Museum, please call 681-231-2400.

West Virginia’s premier artisan market, Tamarack Marketplace, is more than a shopping destination. The cultural hub of southern West Virginia features all things to Shop Local, Eat Local and Art Local. Enjoy seasonal indoor and outdoor events which include artist demonstrations, local musicians, and concerts. Tamarack Marketplace displays over 20,000 works of art from more than 2,800 juried artists and artisans (from all 55 counties in the state!) Glass blowing with our resident glassblower is a must! In addition to our unique shopping experience, indulge in our local cuisine at our Bistro; try our famous fried green tomato sandwich or our legendary chicken pot pie, and be sure to check or our trending daily features prepared by a seasoned culinary team. You can either dine in or take out. Tamarack Marketplace Conference & Event Center is the perfect place for professional engagements or personal events with multiple indoor and outdoor spaces.

The Tawney Farm is a small-scale sheep farm located next to the beautiful Gauley River National Recreation Area in the Mountain Lakes region of central West Virginia. Our 120 acres lie nestled in between two beautiful mountains -- one of them named Panther Mountain-- in the Gauley River gorge. Here we raise and sell Merino and Jacob sheep for their wool. Our farm is also home to miniature horses, chickens, and of course dogs and cats. Except for Gauley whitewater season (weekend after Labor Day through Bridge Day), we provide a totally private primitive camping experience where you will be our only guest. The Tawney Farm is a 120-acre working sheep farm nestled in the beautiful mountains of the Gauley River National Recreation Area. Drink in the beautiful views of the Gauley River gorge and hike our nature trails while experiencing the sights and sounds of a real working farm. Camp on the mountaintop and experience incredible night skies. Or, pop up your tent at one of the shady, wooded campsites along the trail. You can even camp in one of our scenic pastures. Fry up some farm fresh eggs over the campfire or grill! Park-style grills, fire pit grills and camping cook stoves are provided for your use. You are, of course, welcome to bring your own small portable grill. And to make your "roughing it" camping experience not so rough, we've added a few amenities! Clean Portajohns are provided as well as a "to die for" outdoor hot water shower! And get this, firewood is FREE! Close to Summersville Lake & Dam, Carnifex Ferry State Park and just minutes from the wild but beautiful Gauley River, you're sure to find something fun to do while camping with us. Pets are welcome but must remain on a leash at all times. Payment is required to make a reservation which must be made 48 hours in advance.
tags: Hiking, RV and Camping, History & Heritage, Campsites, Resorts

description: We are offering a little bit of country roads and almost heaven in a tucked-away gem in Bomont, WV. Our 1800's farmhouse is less than an hour from Charleston, WV. At the same time, you are deep in the country with the Elk River 1.5 miles away, hiking, ATV riding and down time in a bit of luxury on a budget. We are also a day trip to all that West Virginia has to offer. Come to our haven and just relax. House features 1 king bed , 2 full beds, a queen sleeper sofa, with plenty of room for few more. Sleeps 8 comfortably, but can accommodate up to 12.
tags: ATV & Off-roading, Hiking, Cabins and Vacation Rentals

description: Welcome to the area's newest Farm Market. We invite you to come check out what everyone has been talking about! We carry many West Virginia wines, local honey, different jams and jellies, apple butter, sauces from Oliverio’s Peppers in Clarksburg—in fact, we're so local that some of the honey we will be selling are from the bees that were in our apple orchard for pollinating earlier this spring! We have farm fresh produce, bulk candy, pies, organic ice cream, local meats, baking mixes, organic milk, local free range eggs from Gerrardstown, tomatoes, and much more in season. What we don’t raise ourselves, we are buying from local farmers when available so our customers will have different types of produce to choose from when they walk in our market. This is the best our great area produces, and our family is so happy to bring it all together to share with your family. Taylor's Farm Market is conveniently located right off I-81 in Inwood, WV and opened in May 2014. However, you've seen our family in the Inwood community for a long time: Nearby, owners Bob Taylor and his son Ryan Taylor farm over 1350 acres of row crops and orchards. The Taylor's farm produces over 130,000 bushels of apples, 5,000 bushels of peaches, cherries, plums, and nectarines that are sold in the farm market along with a huge variety of other local produce. Our spot right off the highway here in Inwood has been a place for wholesome, local food for a long time. In 1920 the site was originally developed into the Demonstration Community Apple Packing School. Many apple producers came here to learn best practices for packing the fruit via 12 orchards that sent 120,000 barrels of apples here. It was also a place to have the fruit inspected and graded before shipping it to market on the Cumberland Valley Branch of the Pennsylvania Railroad. The facility was later the Inwood Farmer's Market, pictured above, although the original building pictured burned in 1955. The current building allows us sample space to share the best locally produced fruit, wines, grocery items, dairy, meat, handmade crafts, and bakery items that West Virginia proudly produces.

Take a step or two back in time to understand the intricacy of communication in ages past. The museum contains various switchboards, pay phones, booths, test boards. Take a tour led by knowledgeable women who lived what is now telephone history. Thursdays 9 a.m.-12 p.m. and by appointment (Ring buzzer at door.)

company: Terra Fate - Native Plant Nursery & Tropical Greenhouse
description: We are a family-owned company, motivated by our love of nature and education. We nurture our plants, providing you with the happiest flora. We offer a wide range of native plants for pollinator gardens, restoration projects and landscaping projects. We do on and off site consultations for permaculture and native habitat design. Our tropical greenhouse has a wide selection of house plants, terrarium plants and aquatic plants.

company: Teter Creek Lake Wildlife Management Area - Barbour
description: 137 acres - Hunting limited due to size of area. Teter Creek Lake provides trout and warmwater fishing. Boat launch ramp and physically challenged fisherman trail are available. Campground: No reservations are accepted for the campground, it is on a first come first serve basis. For questions concerning the campground please call the West Virginia State Parks Office in Charleston,
tags: Fishing, Hiking, Hunting and Shooting Sports, RV and Camping, Campsites, Public Waters, Wildlife Management Areas

description: The Bakery & Coffeehouse is a family owned and operated scratch-made Bakery and Coffeehouse providing expertly crafted, unique flavor profiles.
address: 130 W 4 1/2 St Dodge and Rt 14, Williamstown, WV 26187, USA

description: Nestled among 100-ft pine trees, The Barn Loft sits in tranquility. It is the perfect destination to relax after a day of recreating in the New River Gorge. Consider it an upgrade from camping on the ground. And be sure to enjoy the backyard's amenities: a cozy swing, gazebo, picnic area, and fire pit. This is THE glamping experience not to be missed.

company: The Barn With Inn Bed and Breakfast
description: After many years of planning now it's time for guests to have the opportunity to enjoy the property as a reservation only bed and breakfast. The mission of Barn With Inn is to provide a unique farm experience focusing on farm life , animal care and local-farm-to-table foods. The motto is: Feed and be Fed! Rural Elegance with a focus on mindful farming and farm-to-table foods.

YORK HILL is a historic property listed on the National Registry of Historic Places. It is a privately-owned farm that was established and recorded in January of the year 1754 by Lord Fairfax. It has been owned by just three families since that time with our family enjoying its heritage for nearly a century. TODAY it is our pleasure to share our very special farm, an operational orchard, with those who would like a uniquely beautiful place to host an exceptional event. Our stone barn, built on the property in 1812, and the picturesque landscape surrounding the barn have become wonderfully popular locations for a variety of celebrations; most notably, weddings and receptions.
address: 1583 Ridge Rd, Shenandoah Junction, WV 25442, USA

company: The Billy Motel & Bar / ISH Kitchen
description: Newly renovated boutique motel in Davis, WV. The Billy Motel & Bar is a hip, pocket-size, ten-room motel with a bar and cocktail lounge tucked atop the Allegheny Highlands between two up-and-coming mountain towns. Conveniently situated close to area attractions including Blackwater Falls, cafes, galleries, hiking and biking trails, and with a fully stocked bar and coffee service in the mornings. Let The Billy be your home away from home when you visit beautiful Canaan Valley.

The Blennerhassett Restaurant & Lounge continues the long culinary legacy held within these historic walls. From the days of the second-floor restaurant & parlors in the 1800s, up to present day, that legacy stands for pride. We are proud to fulfill your every need to the finest service, whether you are vacationing with us several days, or rather dining for one evening on our lush garden patio. We are proud of our EXCEPTIONAL regional farmers who supply Chef Aly with the freshest ingredients needed to allow her dishes to truly transform. We are proud to be one of many jewels in a downtown community thriving with an abundance of opportunities for arts and culture.

The Bronze Look LLC operates three stores in Southern WV: The Bronze Look at 311 Mercer St, in Princeton; the company's showcase, premier store Diamonds 'N Gold Look at 901 Mercer St., Princeton; and Only One Look, in Bluefield.
NA

company: The Chessie Room Bed and Breakfast
description: The Chessie Room is a suite of rooms in the heart of Huntington, within walking distance of many restaurants, nightspots, theaters, and the Big Sandy Arena. It is part of the old Baltimore and Ohio train station, now called Heritage Station, and located on the second floor of the old Huntington Bank building, allegedly robbed by the Jesse James gang in 1875. Fact or fiction, it's our story and we are sticking to it. The Chessie Room is Smoke Free. Please contact us about stays longer than 5 days. Amenities include: An enclosed outside sitting area. Master Bedroom furnished with a queen size bed. Full size sofa bed in sitting room. Separate kitchenette. Cast iron bath tub with claw feet. Parking is located in Heritage Station parking lot in the rear of the bank building. Be prepared to walk up a flight of stairs to the second floor (elevator would not be authentic). Complimentary breakfast is provided by a local restaurant. However, it is a three block walk from the Chessie Room so you can work up an appetite. They do deliver on Sunday.

company: The Clay Center for the Arts and Sciences
description: The Clay Center for the Arts & Sciences of West Virginia opened on July 12, 2003. The Center, a 240,000 square foot structure, houses performing arts, visual arts and sciences under one roof – one of the few of its kind in the country. Located in the state’s capital city of Charleston, the facility is home to the Clay Center’s Avampato Discovery Museum, the Juliet Art Museum and the Maier Foundation Performance Hall, home of the West Virginia Symphony Orchestra. The Clay Center’s mission is to inspire creativity, learning and wonder through experiences in the Arts and Sciences for all people of West Virginia and the region. The Clay Center remains one of the most ambitious economic, cultural and educational undertakings in West Virginia history. The Clay Center enhances the region’s “quality of life” and enriches the lives of all West Virginians.

The Cockayne Farmstead is a time capsule of rural American life and an active site of conservation and discovery. Once comprised of over 300 acres, the Cockayne Farm served as the namesake of Glen Dale. Coming to Western Virginia in the 1790s, the Cockaynes were prominent early settlers in Marshall County. Today, you can visit the family’s 1850 home, explore our ancient Adena burial mound, see an excavated privy, and learn about everyday life in the 1800s. The farmhouse, yet to be restored, is teeming with original artifacts and beautiful works of art produced by the family. See layers of original wallpaper newly discovered by conservators, play our 1880’s piano, and experience what life was like at the turn of the twentieth century in Marshall County.
address: 1111 Wheeling Ave, Glen Dale, WV 26038, USA

description: Started as a craft coffee shop, The Cocktail Bar (aka The Coffee Bar) has evolved into a full Cocktail Bar & New American Restaurant.

Come experience Fayette County at its finest. Be our guest at The Confluence Resort, a wilderness wedding destination and luxury vacation homes located on over 300 spectacular green acres bordering The Gauley River National Recreation Area — with direct access to both the Gauley and Meadow Rivers.
address: 825 Patterson Ferry Rd, Hico, WV 25854, USA

description: Just Located on Rt. 19 at Spanishburg, WV, it is just four miles from Interstate 77, exit 14. The historic cabin retreat has an absolutely beautiful setting, situated on a 60-acre farm in the Bluestone Valley, surrounded by beautiful mountains and bordered by the Bluestone River. Five state parks are within a 30 minute drive. The Country Cabin is near many sites and activities visitors enjoy in southern West Virginia. Fully equipped, just bring groceries! WiFi/cable tv. Near Princeton/Bluefield, hospitals * colleges.

THE CUSTARD STAND restaurant in Flatwoods, WV, offers indoor dining and serves lunch and dinner daily. America's tastiest chili dogs. Burgers, fries, 50-plus flavors of soft serve, and more! Open daily for indoor dining; walk-up window; outdoor dining on side patio; and takeout.

Named one of the 101 Unique Places to Dine in WV for our authentic WV hot dogs topped with Custard Stand Hot Dog Chili and Custard Stand Chili Soup with Beef & Beans. Our chili products were featured on ABCs Shark Tank (S7 ep19). Full menu available. 30+ flavors of ice cream. Open year-round. Dining room, walk-up window, and outside seating available. Dining room closes 1 hour earlier than the listed closing time.
address: 51 S Main St, Webster Springs, WV 26288, USA

description: The Dish Café is a culinary delight bringing unique flavor combinations, fresh ingredients and made-from-scratch recipes to your table. Try the Chicken Parmesan Pasta or opt for the Falafel Salad on your next visit.

The Fifth Floor is home to hot pepper and hot sausage soup made with local Demus sausage, as well as fabulous martinis, a huge single-malt scotch collection, beautiful vistas of downtown Clarksburg and a manager and bartender second to none. The restaurant is located on the top floor (Fifth Floor) of the former Broida’s building, which was built in 1920s and housed fine women’s fashion, including a furrier, for several generations.
Known for one of the best prime ribs on the east coast. In 2018, the Final Cut Steakhouse at the Hollywood Casino at Charles Town Races won a prestigious Wine Spectator Magazine award.
address: 750 Hollywood Dr, Charles Town, WV 25414, USA

description: Visit the Flatwoods Monster Museum located on Main Street in downtown Sutton, just two miles from Exit 62 on I-79. Displays include: one of a kind collections and artifacts, historic items, memorabilia, books, and more! Admission is FREE. Novelty items, such as shirts, figures, stickers, shot glasses, and lanterns are available for purchase. Call ahead before visiting to ensure availability. Special visiting hours possible. Closed on: Christmas, Christmas Eve, Easter, Thanksgiving, New Year's Day

Indulge in a unique dining experience at The Forks, where French and Appalachian-American flavors come together to create a fusion of taste and culture. This intimate, reservation-only dining room and cocktail bar provide a personalized atmosphere, allowing them to tailor your culinary journey to your individual preferences. Enjoy a carefully crafted menu that features only the freshest and highest-quality ingredients.
address: Kelly Mountain Rd, Elkins, WV 26241, USA

description: We invite you to stop in, browse, and enjoy shopping in our beautiful store! We can help you select that special item and we offer free gift wrap. Just a few steps up from the center of town next to the Livery Tavern, southern hospitality starts at our Front Porch!
Located at The Mountaineer Casino Racetrack & Resort
address: 1420 Mountaineer Cir, New Cumberland, WV 26047, USA

description: Summer comes to life at The Greenbrier, America’s Resort. Sip on a refreshing cocktail, explore 11,000 acres of beautiful mountains, test your luck at the on-site casino or take the horse-drawn carriage around the resort. The resort’s excellence is perhaps best defined by its array of restaurants for any palate. Don’t pass up a tour of the once secret cold war bunker. This is life as few know it. Stay for a day, a cozy weekend or a lifetime. Learn More
address: 101 W Main St, White Sulphur Springs, WV 24986, USA

description: Summer comes to life at The Greenbrier, America’s Resort. description: Our vacation rentals are located in the Hinton National Historic District and are within easy walking distance of restaurants, museums, shopping, a movie theatre, and a waterslide and pool.

description: THE GUEST HOUSE: Sleeps 6-8. Relax and enjoy this lovely, historic turn-of-the-century home. Sleeps 6-8. The Guest House is completely furnished. This is comfort, privacy and affordability all wrapped up in one! Two queen bedrooms, two baths-1 walk-in shower & 1 clawfoot tub & shower, fully equipped kitchen, living and dining rooms, sunroom with twin daybed & trundle, washer, dryer, quiet sitting/reading area upstairs, and inviting front porch. Queen air mattress, also provided. WiFi, TV, DVD & AC. THE COTTAGE: Sleeps 2-4; Peaceful & cozy, fully furnished for your comfort. Beautifully tiled bath/shower; bedroom with antique double bed and lovely view; fully equipped kitchen with apt fridge; living room with electric fireplace & double loveseat sleeper. WiFi, TV, DVD, & AC.

description: Water, power (30 & 50 amps), sewer and pull-thrus. Open May 1-Oct 15. Exit 150 off I-64, Dawson
address: 2204 Lawn Rd, Meadow Bridge, WV 25976, USA

description: Located in the heart of Canaan Valley in Tucker County, West Virginia, The Inn at Canaan sits on over 10 acres of beautiful rolling land surrounded by views of the mountains. The Inn features 18 modernistic, pet-friendly rooms with a mini fridge, microwave, flat screen TV, and free WIFI. An 18-hole miniature golf course is located on premises and is perfect for families. Several restaurants are located within walking distance. In addition, The Inn at Canaan is the closest motel to the slopes. Timberline Mountain, Canaan Resort, and White Grass Nordic Ski Center are all within a five minute drive. No matter the season, The Inn at Canaan is the perfect place to stay when visiting the area. Check In: 3pm Check Out: 11am
tags: Golf, Shopping, Cabins and Vacation Rentals, Hotels & Motels

company: The Inn At Charles Town Races
description: If you’ve come to play, you can stay in comfort at The Inn at Charles Town, located on the grounds of Hollywood Casino at Charles Town Races. Nestled in the Shenandoah Valley and surrounded by the scenic Blue Ridge Mountains, The Inn at Charles Town serves as the perfect oasis, offering first-class amenities and rich interiors just steps from exciting casino action and thoroughbred horse racing. The Inn at Charles Town features 18 spacious suites, all with premier views of the thoroughbred race track. Free shuttle service is available to guests seeking to visit the race track and Hollywood Casino.
address: 751 Hollywood Dr, Charles Town, WV 25414, USA
tags: Dining & Drinks, Music, Nightlife & Entertainment, Hotels & Motels, Resorts

description: At our beautifully appointed Elkins, WV Hotel, we know comfort personally. Let us introduce you. Start with a room professionally designed for relaxation, and add all of the top-quality amenities: mini-fridges, coffee makers, free WIFI, flat-screen TVs and DirectTV in every room. And, for those who require it, ADA wheelchair-accessible rooms are available, too. Those finer details? We've taken extra care with those, as well. From the high-quality shampoos to the real glassware, we've crafted every detail to give you an elegant stay. Every convenience is here, including a fitness center and state-of-the-art business center. We even have large conference rooms, perfect for business meetings, banquets and gatherings. Please contact the hotel for details. Do you want to know what's about town? We'd be happy to help you explore Elkins. Hungry? Breakfast each morning is included, and features a wonderful array of hot and continental treats. For later in the day, our restaurant is on site featuring juicy burgers, tasty sandwiches, and our chef's succulent steaks, seafood, and barbecue. Come visit us at the Isaac Jackson. We'll make every visit your best.

company: The James Wylie House Bed and Breakfast
description: An early 19th century home (circa 1819) and log cabin (circa 1794.) Offering private baths, air conditioning and sumptuous breakfast served at the convenience of our guests. Children are welcome! The James Wylie House is located in the village of White Sulphur Springs at the base of the Allegheny Mountains. Built in 1819 for the Greenbrier Pioneer, Richard Dickson, the property evolved from a working farm of over 1300 acres to a boarding house. Fully restored and placed on the National Registry of Historic Homes in 1990, the B&B continues its long history of hosting travelers. Our rooms welcome guests with wonderful antiques and views of the beautiful mountains which surround us. Close to state parks and rivers which offer many outdoor adventures. Located just down the street from the renowned Greenbrier Resort, we offer convenient lodging for travelers on business. We host retreats for groups of up to 10 persons. For nearly 200 years, this beautiful home has hosted the many travelers visiting the Spa City, golfing the many renowned courses, and hiking in the surrounding State and National Forests. Built in 1819 by master builder John Dunn, the house began life as a farmhouse commanding over 1,300 acres of land. Fully restored, the house and cabin were place on the National Register of Historic Homes in 1990.
address: 125 Schoolhouse Way, White Sulphur Springs, WV 24986, USA
tags: History & Heritage, Bed & Breakfasts, Cabins and Vacation Rentals

company: The Landmark Studio for the Arts
description: The Landmark Studio for the Arts is located on Main Street, in Sutton's Historic Downtown District. Housed in a circa 1896 Victorian era church, the building was purchased and renovated in 1988 to create a stage. The original WV made stained glass windows are intact. Over the years the stage has been expanded and green rooms were added. The Landmark Studio is a not for profit community arts organization which presents theater, music, Humanities programs, film and children's events. The resident community theater is known as the Landmark Players and the children's division as Landmark Youth Theater Ensemble (LYTE). We have been home to the WV FilmMakers Festival and the Melvin Wine Old Time Music Concert. Tickets are purchased at the door and reservations can be made by calling the Landmark at 304-644-3166. Information is available on the website for schedules, board members and other activities (landmarkstudioforthearts.org).

We are pub and grill nestled in Point Pleasant, WV offering the tastiest food and best beer selection around. We are also the only pub and grill in the area featuring live music four nights a week! Stop by or call ahead to enjoy our awesome menu and relaxed vibe. We value our customers' experience, and we want to offer you the best food and live entertainment around. Stop on on by. We'd be happy to serve you! Bar & Grill · Sports Bar · Coffee Shop
address: 64 White Ridge Rd, Point Pleasant, WV 25550, USA

description: The Loud is a live music venue and outdoor beer garden in Huntington, WV. The beer selection will heavily feature local brews from Bad Shepherd Beer Company in Charleston, WV. The Loud may be a new name in Huntington, but it is just a refreshed label for one of the Tri-State’s longest-running music venues. It has been a staple of live music in Huntington. During the shutdown of 2020, it was decided to give the V Club an overhaul. It has been freshly renovated, updated the sound system, and is ready to rock for many years to come. Since 2006 The VClub has features national and regional acts, such as Tyler Childers, Less Than Jake, The Avett Brothers, Corrosion of Conformity, Every Time I Die, Clutch, Lucero, Jason Isbell, Hank Williams III and the list goes on. The Loud continues the same tradition with the same owners.

Stop by for lunch or dinner at The Market on the corner of Second Avenue and Ballengee Street in the Hinton National Historic District. We make fresh food with quality ingredients. Get a brick-oven pizza, burger, soup, salad, sandwich, and house-made desserts.

A restaurant, convenience store, and fuel stop conveniently located just off interstate 64. The restaurant is closed on Mondays and major holidays. Home style cooking in a casual atmosphere. Breakfast is served until 11 a.m. Daily specials and homemade desserts are also available.
Historic Landmark offering lodging and event space.

Lunch, dinner, drinks, live music. You don't want to miss their selection of craft beers, unique local dishes and more. Perfect spot for relaxing! The RailYard is a restaurant, cocktail lounge, and live music venue located in the heart of The Depot District in Historic Downtown Bluefield, West Virginia. A little food, a little drink & a lot of class!

company: The Ravenswood Inn Bed and Breakfast
description: The Ravenswood Inn Bed & Breakfast is a lovely restored Late Victorian Era Folk Style house with an interior exceptionally appointed by nationally known interior designer Kim Quillen of Ravenswood. We have three comfortable rooms. The Inn is adjacent to downtown Ravenswood, and is walking distance to antique stores, restaurants, and parks.

company: The Ridges - West Virginia's Newest Zipline Adventure
description: Experience West Virginia’s newest zipline located on site at River Expeditions. Thrill-seeker meets nature-lover for this exciting 1 to 1.5-hour treetop adventure. Professional guides lead you along four ziplines and adventure skybridge, offering a rare perspective of the rugged WV forest and wildlife. Bonus rappel experience at the end of the tour. Soar among the treetops as you zip along, following your guide to the next platform. Cabins and rafting also available.
address: 900 Broadway Ave, Oak Hill, WV 25901, USA
tags: RV and Camping, Rock Climbing, Watersports, Whitewater rafting, Shopping, Cabins and Vacation Rentals, Campsites, Resorts

description: Charleston's premiere venue for events, weddings, and community gatherings.

company: The Ritz Theatre - Cinema & Performing Arts
description: Blockbuster movies are shown every weekend in our theatre with state-of-the-art digital projection and sound. Featuring free admission to family-friendly movies in the summer, and free admission to holiday movies from Thanksgiving through Christmas.

The River House is a friendly, "sit and stay awhile" community arts and music venue. The beautiful historic building on the banks of the Cacapon River hosts live musical performances, art classes, community gatherings and artisan market. In addition to participatory "arts for all" activities, local artists enjoy a venue for demonstrating and selling their work. The welcoming cafe offers pastries, ice cream, coffee, drinks (including beer and wine) and delicious, local "comfort food" and Free WiFi.
address: 24 Rickie Davy Ln, Capon Bridge, WV 26711, USA

description: The Salt Cave and Spa invites you to a day of pampering and well-being. With diverse options, including a Salt Cave, caring specialists and the purest of products, we strive to create a lasting impression in both relaxation and health renewal. All this is set in an unique earth-friendly underground man-made cave.
address: 6705 Pocahontas Trl, White Sulphur Springs, WV 24986, USA

description: This restaurant at Blackwater Falls State Park is open daily and offers breakfast, lunch and dinner, serving the best regional fare, where “the dining rivals the view.”
address: 1584 Blackwater Lodge Rd, Davis, WV 26260, USA

description: Originally built in as a vaudeville house in 1926, The Smooth Theatre has been entertaining the Mid-Ohio Valley for over 90 years. Enjoy all kinds of live entertainment here at the Smoot Theatre.

company: The Stirrup Gallery of Davis and Elkins College
description: Where can you learn about the Roman Empire, marvel over a collection of brilliantly colored butterflies from Peru and get an up-close look at tools used by Native Americans? Open the glass doors to The Stirrup Gallery in Myles Center for the Arts where a world of days gone by awaits. Originally established in 2013 as a home to the 10,000-plus North American treasures of The Darby Collection, The Stirrup Gallery has continued to grow to include nine additional collections – the Lincoln Collection, Howard-Sudbrink Collection, Eleanor Gay Collection, Foster Collection, Senator Davis Collection, Swezy Collection, Gary North Collection, J. Richard & Dotty S. Kendig Collection and Reckling Collection.
The Studio Shepherdstown is a charming tiny house rental in downtown historic Shepherdstown, West Virginia.
address: 301 S King St, Shepherdstown, WV 25443, USA

description: The Union Pub and Grill has been a Huntington staple since 1991. Located on 4th Avenue, Herb Stanley has given Huntington a great place to meet up with friends, watch "the game" or wind down after a long week at work. Join them online and at the bar too!

company: The Vault on Main: Restaurant & Wine Bar
description: The Vault on Main is a restaurant and wine bar located in the heart of Summersville at the historic Nicholas Bank. Offering traditional fine dining and wine to match with any cuisine, The Vault is the perfect spot for a meal or your next event.
tags: Dining & Drinks, Farm-To-Table, Music, Nightlife & Entertainment

company: The West Virginia Mine Wars Museum
description: In the town of Matewan, the West Virginia Mine Wars Museum sits at the site of a historic battle that erupted in May of 1920, setting into motion a chain of events that led to the largest armed uprising in the United States since our civil war. Over 10,000 people from many different cultures joined together and rose up, fighting for basic human rights, labor justice, their lives, and their families. The West Virginia Mine Wars Museum preserves and uplifts the voices of the people who lived these stories of sacrifice, violence, and triumph.  Come experience the largest exhibition of Mine Wars history anywhere in the United States! Explore this legacy with compelling exhibits of archival photos and videos, first-person accounts, rare artifacts and replicas, and detailed timelines placing the events of the Mine Wars era in a global context. Step into the era with the miners and their families!

The Wild Bean has all the warmth and hospitality of a local community diner while at the same time the vibe of a hip urban coffee shop. Looking through the front windows you might see people eating, drinking, chatting, playing chess, reading a newspaper, using a laptop or any number of activities. Once you enter the doors you are greeted with the aroma of freshly brewed coffee and baked goods from the kitchen. Serving fresh roasted organic coffees, espresso, milk shakes, smoothies, baked goods and vegetarian cuisine. Free wireless internet and computer terminals available.
address: 1056 E Washington St, Lewisburg, WV 24901, USA

description: The Wild Ramp is a year-round Farmers' Market and Local Foods store that showcases West Virginia food and artisan products. We are located at the heart of the Old Central City Antiques District in Huntington, WV. Our products are grown and made within 250 miles of Huntington. We offer everything from fresh produce, dairy, cheese, meat, fresh eggs, ice cream, jams, jellies, and sauces, locally roasted coffee, and the best local brews and wine! As well as, artisan made soaps, lotions, and other handcrafted goods. Follow us on Facebook to stay informed about what farmers are bringing to the market, as well as, cooking classes and our annual Farm-to-Table Dinner.

The Woods is just 90 minutes from D.C. and Baltimore and offers the perfect day-trip getaway for golfing and spa, a world apart from everyday hassles. Over the past 40+ years, countless numbers of their guests have become part-time or permanent residents, drawn to the tranquility and beauty of its 1800 acres at the northern gateway to the Shenandoah Valley. Guests enjoy 36 holes of golf, spa services, indoor & outdoor swimming, tennis, hiking, and much more.
address: 1630 The Woods Rd, Hedgesville, WV 25427, USA
tags: Golf, Spas, Dining & Drinks, Cabins and Vacation Rentals, Resorts

description: If today's fast paced world gets to be too much, visit us and stay in one of our lushly decorated rooms. This is truly an inn devoted to a simpler way of life and none of its six guest rooms have televisions in them. However, guests may choose to stay connected by the inn's wireless network or the one television in the lounge. Complete with a delicious breakfast in the morning, this bed and breakfast makes returning home almost impossible.
address: 300 W German St, Shepherdstown, WV 25443, USA

description: 4-H camp for one week of the year, is also open to the public with cabins for rent, full hookups for trailers and RVs, and campsites for tenters. Reasonably priced and with large playing fields, Thorn Spring Park is an ideal location for a family or group outing. Large groups can rent the pavilion and kitchen facilities. Adjacent woods and stream beckon naturalists. Cabins sleep from 8 - 22 people. Each cabin has its own bathroom, refrigerator, sink and range plus a wood-burning stove. Guests bring their own linens and cookware. Tenters have access to a bathhouse with restroom and shower facilities. Pets allowed on leash, owners must clean up after them. Children under 8 stay free. Open all year.
address: 42 All Star Dr, Franklin, WV 26807, USA
tags: RV and Camping, Cabins and Vacation Rentals, Campsites

description: If it's BIG trout you're looking to catch, or want to become a better fisherman, you have come to the right place! Three Rivers Guiding offers all day and half day wading, and onshore fishing trips on 3 of the best trout streams in West Virginia.

Special Programs & Walking tours available. Exhibits include restored passenger depot, historic furnishings, exhibits of interaction between coal miners and railroad, abandoned buildings in Thurmond townsite.

Tidewater Grill is one of Charleston’s all-time favorite dining and gathering restaurants. Located in Charleston’s bustling downtown shopping venue, Tidewater Grill has wowed guests for over thirty years with an emphasis on offering premium seafood served simply! This all scratch kitchen continues the tradition of fresh catch of the day, homemade pasta dishes, fresh raw bar delicacies as well as other favorites such as the Greek salad, signature bread, sandwiches and salads.
address: 1060 Charleston Town Center, Charleston, WV 25389, USA

description: In addition to its dramatic snowmaking capabilities and action-packed slopes, Timberline Mountain is a scenic destination for adventurers to explore this winter. When nature is ready for you to hit the slopes, Timberline’s $10 million-dollar capital improvements grant you access to two brand new chairlifts – one of which is the only high-speed size-person chair in West Virginia.
