description: Motocross facility open 7 days a week from 10am - 5pm. Several tracks and trails open to families and ATVs. Tracks accommodate riders of all ability levels. Kids courses and dirt drags also available. Easily accessible from I-81. No charge for camping. Pets welcome. Check our website for admission and practice fees, as well as additional information.
address: 863 Tomahawk Run Rd, Hedgesville, WV 25427, USA

description: This quaint 19th century town is designated a National Historic District by the National Register. The architecture of the houses and shops reflect the town's history as a transportation hub 1800 - 1860, a strategic location during the Civil War, a thriving industrial center based on water power in the late 1800s. The Harpers Ferry National Historic Park offers museums, events, and tours. The Appalachian Trail courses through town as its halfway mark between Georgia and Maine.
address: 1000 Washington St, Harpers Ferry, WV 25425, USA

description: The Town's Inn consists of two pre-Civil War stone residences circa 1840 situated in the heart of historic Harpers Ferry, surrounded by the Harpers Ferry National Historic Park. The Bistro,1840, is open 11:00 a.m. - 7:00p.m. daily. The Mountain House contains the Hostel (6 beds and a sitting area) and the Café Shoppe is open daily 6 a.m. – 10 p.m. MEALS ARE NOT INCLUDED IN THE PRICE OF LODGING Pets are allowed at a price of $30/pet.

Our TownePlace Suites Bridgeport Clarksburg hotel is located right off of the highway and is an extended stay property. Guests will enjoy free WiFI, fill-sized refrigerator, dishwasher, burner top, utensils and microwave in every room, onsite business and fitness center, indoor pool and full bar in the evenings.

Whether you’re in town for a night, weekend, or extended stay, you’ll be at home at our TownePlace Suites Marriott®. Settle in to your well designed suite and take advantage of your fully equipped kitchen and high speed internet. Enjoy your spacious home office and Container Store closet. Join us for a complimentary breakfast buffet every morning and make use of our fire-pit, Weber grills, indoor swimming pool and fitness center. We are conveniently located downtown Parkersburg, WV. Neighborhood-style living featuring comfortable, casual suites at a great value. Warm, inviting staff, available 24/7, that will make you feel right at home. Sign into your Netflix or Hulu account on your flat panel TV or enjoy an array of HD channels, including HBO.

The TownePlace Suites by Marriott is centrally located to serve the regions business districts including the Huntington, WV and Ashland, KY regions. Just minutes from Marshall University and downtown shopping and dining. Relax and feel at home in your suite with a fully equipped kitchen. Complimentary wireless internet is available throughout the property. Featuring an outdoor pool and social area with a Weber grill.

company: Trans Allegheny Lunatic Asylum (formerly Weston State Hospital)
description: This West Virginia facility served as a sanctuary for the mentally ill in the mid-1800’s. The history of the building holds fascinating stories of Civil War raids, a gold robbery, the "curative" effects of architecture, and the efforts of determined individuals to help better the lives of the mentally ill. We offer daytime historic tours including museum rooms, night time paranormal tours, overnight ghost hunts, photo tours, festivals flashlight tours and a haunted house .
address: 50 S River Ave, Weston, WV 26452, USA

description: Espresso bar, teas, freshly baked pastries, sandwiches and curated selection of chocolates and gourmet foods.
address: 41 S Robert Stone Way, Reedsville, WV 26547, USA

description: Tricky Fish is a beach bar & grill marooned in Wild Wonderful West Virginia near the Capitol Complex. We feature baskets, sandwiches and tacos with WV pulled pork BBQ, catfish, Mahi - Mahi, shrimp, and chicken. We also have WV Italian Sausages, Nathan's Famous Hot Dogs, chicken wings, crab cakes, oysters, and WV hot bologna sandwiches. We offer a good selection of local and micro-brewed beers and great Margaritas!
address: 1611 Washington St E, Charleston, WV 25305, USA

description: Triple B arena offers team Roping, NBHA & IBRA - Barrel Racing and Championship Bull Riding.
address: 203 Barbeque Dr, Berkeley Springs, WV 25411, USA

description: 16 RV & tent spots available with full hookups, city water & 50 amp electrical service, free WiFi, Oil & Gas workers welcome, pets welcome.

At the junction of the Ohio and Kanawha Rivers stands a monument which commemorates the frontiersmen who fought and died at the Battle of Point Pleasant. This battle was fought with Chief Cornstalk on October 10,1774, and is recognized as the decisive engagement in a proactive series of Indian wars. The name "Tu-Endie-Wei" is a Wyandotte word meaning "point between two waters." The historical park celebrating the 1774 Battle of Point Pleasant and Mansion House Museum that was built in 1796. There is no admission fee of visit this attraction in Mason County. Visit the park web link below for history, hours of operation and activities available.
address: 1 Main St, Point Pleasant, WV 25550, USA

description: Originally built in 1905 and renovated in 2011, the Tug Valley Inn is one of Williamson's oldest remaining buildings in its downtown area. We offer modern conveniences combined with traditional charm, comfortable, casual lodging on Williamson's main street, Second Avenue. Let us be your home away from home in the Tug Valley. We have eight guests rooms, all with private baths. ATV riders are welcome as we are conveniently located just two streets from Williamson's trail connector.
tags: ATV & Off-roading, Bed & Breakfasts, Cabins and Vacation Rentals

description: Enjoy an après-ski treat at Tuque’s Bar and Grill at Snowshoe Mountain. You’ll find signature hot drinks, appetizers and delicious entrees.

company: Turkey Run Lake Wildlife Management Area
description: 15 acre lake. Located on Rt. 68 just north of Ravenswood. Maximum depth of 9 feet, and an average depth of 6 feet. This lake is stocked on a regular basis with trout. In addition, Turkey Run has several species of bass, sunfish, catfish, crappie and northern pike. Non-game fish such as suckers and carp are also present.

Southern WV's Mountaintop ATV Resort! Twin Hollow Campground and Cabins is located off Rt.52 near the small town of Gilbert, WV, Twin Hollow offers Mountaintop Cabins, along w/ Mountaintop Full Hookup & Primitives' Camping all with Direct Access to the Hatfield McCoy Trails along with Locally Owned Trail Houses n the ATV Friendly Town of Gilbert, WV. Guests have direct access to over 300 miles of The Hatfield McCoy Trial Systems. The award winning PT12 Restaurant is now located at our Entrance off of Rt.52. Mountaintop Adventures offer's daily to weekly SXS Rentals & Guided Tours along with an offroad shop ATVenture Powersports both open daily onsite as well. The Hatfield McCoy Trails Original Resort! Locally Owned & Operated Est. 2002!
address: 703 Twin Hollow Branch Rd, Gilbert, WV 25621, USA
tags: ATV & Off-roading, Fishing, Hiking, RV and Camping, Watersports, Cabins and Vacation Rentals, Campsites, Public Waters

description: Welcome to Tygart Hotel—where history meets luxury in the heart of Elkins, West Virginia. Our beautifully restored hotel boasts 56 uniquely designed guest rooms, offering an array of sleeping accommodations from the plush comfort of our king and queen rooms to the spaciousness of our king suites. Each corner of the Tygart Hotel celebrates the rich tapestry of West Virginia's cultural heritage. Our walls serve as a canvas for the works of local artists, painting a narrative of the hidden stories from the mountains and the ghost towns of yesteryears—a homage that beckons the curious traveler to explore the wonders of our region. Nestled within our walls is the distinguished Louise McNeill Conference Room. Dedicated to the memory of the esteemed professor and West Virginia poet laureate, this meeting space can host up to 60 people for business meetings or small celebrations. The conference room also includes a separate set up area, a balcony overlooking the bustling downtown, and private restrooms. When the day's work or sightseeing is through, have an elevated dining experience at the Oxley House. This full-service cocktail bar and restaurant is your spot to unwind with a signature drink and tantalizing cuisine—served with a dash of West Virginia hospitality. At Tygart Hotel, inclusivity extends beyond our warm welcome; it's a commitment woven into the fabric of every stay. As part of the Choice Hotels Ascend Collection, we honor your loyalty with exclusive rewards through the Choice Privileges program, ensuring that each visit enriches your travels. Guests can leisurely stroll to the vibrant downtown district, where shopping, dining, and entertainment await. Here, amid the charm and hospitality of Elkins, Tygart Hotel places you at the crossroads of cultural allure and contemporary comfort. Join us at Tygart Hotel—your portal to adventure, a blend of historical intrigue, and the promise of unforgettable memories. Whether for a night or an extended getaway, find your place in the story that is uniquely ours and passionately shared. Your exploration of West Virginia's beauty and heritage begins the moment you step through our doors.

The 18-hole "Tygart Lake" course at the Tygart Lake Public Golf Course facility in Grafton, West Virginia features 6,255 yards of golf from the longest tees for a par of 72 . The course rating is 69.8 and it has a slope rating of 123 on Blue grass. Tygart Lake Club House features a full bar with an extensive beer menu, the Sandwedge snack bar where a variety of different customized food and beverage menu options are available, and a Proshop featuring Tygart Lake Golf Course Mechandise.

Tygart Lake State Park features a spacious 20-room lodge with sleeping rooms looking out over the waters of Tygart Lake. The restaurant at the lodge is great and operated by Apple Annie's. The lake stretches 11 miles, offering boating, swimming, fishing and scuba diving. The 11-vacation cabins are rented seasonally with online reservations available, 24/7. The 40 campsites (14 with electric, 16 for smaller RVs) game courts, gift shop, playground, hiking trails and a marina with boat rentals and concessions stand make Tygart Lake an outdoor recreation mecca. Small meetings are welcomed year-round. The park website maintains hours of operation, special events and special rate getaways as well as park location and trail map.
address: 1240 Paul E. Malone Rd, Grafton, WV 26354, USA
tags: Fishing, Hiking, RV and Camping, Watersports, Cabins and Vacation Rentals, Campsites

description: Specializing in half-day Express Trips for time-sensitive and budget-savvy travelers with morning and afternoon departures available. Trips daily from April - October for ages 6 + on the New & Gauley Rivers. Campground, RV park, Cabins from rustic to luxury, Saloon, Outdoor Pool, Hot Tub, Lodge, Gift Shop, Restaurant, Arcade and more. An affordable alternative to a full day rafting trip for groups and friends. Discover history, nature, culture and adventure in the New River Gorge.

description: In 2013 Matt Welsch, the Vagabond Chef, traversed the country by motorcycle discovering and exploring the culinary renaissance in the United States. At the end of the year, Welsch returned home to the Wheeling with a wealth of restaurant and food experience, inspiration, and excitement which became the foundation of the Vagabond Kitchen.

company: Valley Bend Wetland Wildlife Management Area
description: Wild Life management area located in Randolph County. 15 miles south of Elkins via State Routes 219/250.

Valley Falls State Park is a day-use park with fishing and picnicking. The 18 miles of hiking and mountain bike trails are open to the public. Once the site of a lumber and grist mill community, the scenic treasure of Valley Falls State Park is located only a short drive from Fairmont and Grafton, WV. There is no admission to enter state operated parks and forests.
address: 720 Valley Falls Rd, Fairmont, WV 26554, USA

description: Valley Motel in Valley Grove is a motel with great amenities that are sure to fit even the tightest budget. It offers clean, comfortable and quiet rooms for travelers. Valley Motel is also pet friendly.
address: 9455 National Rd, Valley Grove, WV 26060, USA

description: Valley Park provides water slides, walking trails, volleyball, tennis, playgrounds, miniature golf and other activities including picnic shelters, ball fields, Waves of Fun, and a community center.

Virginia's Chapel and Slave Cemetery is in Cedar Grove, West Virginia. This quaint chapel served as a Confederate hospital and Union stable during the war. A slave cemetery is located behind the church.
address: E Dupont Ave, Cedar Grove, WV, USA

description: Plan your Romantic Getaway, Anniversary Trip, or Glamping experience in our cozy Glamping Domes. 5-star rated, Features: Heated beds, A/C, Heat, Private Hot Tubs, Private Bathrooms, Keurig, Kitchenette, Propane Grill, Stainless Steel Fire Pit... & more. Guests enjoy Complimentary Kayaking, Yard Games, Paddle-Boarding. Available E-bike Rentals. Located in the heart of the Greenbrier Valley, with tons of award winning restaurants nearby, a stay at WV Glamping Domes™ is an experience you will remember for a lifetime. Each dome has its own vibe. During your glamping getaway, you can observe Wild River Otters in our stream, Red-Breasted and Red-Tail hawks, Kingfishers, Great Blue Herons, countless Deer, and occasionally a Red Fox, or Beavers. During the summer months, the Lightning Bugs/Fireflies light up our meadows with millions of magical twinkling lights, and on any clear night you can see the milky way overhead year-round accompanied by millions of stars. Each dome is equipped with a stargazing roof and guests love stargazing while in bed. We are a family ran business located on a historic 65 acre farm with meadow, mountain, and creekside views. Escape to luxury...Immersed in Nature™ at WV Glamping Domes.

company: WVU Jackson's Mill Farmstead & Heritage Programs
description: demonstrations can include grist milling, weaving, spinning, basket making, candle dipping, wood working, blacksmithing, paper marbling and other heritage arts that were a part of frontier life. These activities are set against a historic backdrop that features the Old Mill – the only original structure left from Tom Jackson’s day – as well as other authentic 18th and 19th century buildings. Tours/programs can run from 2 hours to all day.
address: 160 Jackson Mill Rd, Weston, WV 26452, USA

company: WVU Jackson’s Mill State 4-H Conference Center
description: Conference center - handles groups up to 400. All types of equipment needed for any meeting, educational schooling, etc. Fully-equipped computer lab. A mill, 4-H camp, museum housing agricultural, milling and homestead artifacts from 18th century. A cemetery on the grounds holds the graves of Jackson’s grandparents. Relocated to the site: the McWhorter Cabin (c. 1793), Blaker’s Mill (c. 1794) and the Mary Conrad Cabin. Visit website for info. I-79 Exit 99, left toward Weston onto Rt 33W. At fourth light, turn right onto Route 19 N. Turn left onto Jackson's Mill Road, cross the bridge, WVU Jackson's Mill is on right.
address: 160 Jackson Mill Rd, Weston, WV 26452, USA

description: Located along the South Branch of the Potomac River, 5 miles south of Romney, West Virginia in beautiful and historic Hampshire County. We offer over 250 sites with an abundance of shade trees, on the ridge overlooking the South Branch River Valley and in the meadow. 193 sites offer full hookup, 16 sites with Water/Electric, 44 primitive sites for tents and self contained RV's; 20, 30 & 50 AMP hook-up available, pets allowed (call about exceptions and rules) bath house, playground, WI-FI, dump station, boat ramp, fishing, swimming, camp store, propane, ice and bait. Golf carts are permitted. No ATV's or Dirt Bikes.
address: 145 Wapocoma Campground Rd, Romney, WV 26757, USA

company: Washington Heritage Trail National Scenic Byway Welcome Center
description: Full service Welcome Center in Caperton Station, home to Amtrak, MARC & Pan Tran. Book shop, large waiting area, regional and WV brochures, train and bus ticketing information. Clean restrooms.
address: 229 E Martin St, Martinsburg, WV 25401, USA

description: Water Ways is an outdoor waterpark with waterslides, a lazy river, kiddy island and more. Water Ways has five total slides, 2 body slides and 1 tube slide that empties into the lazy river. Kiddy Island is an island dedicated to young children equipped with slides, swings and a water umbrella. At Water Ways you'll also find a walking trail, sheltered picnic area, gift shop and junior Olympic size pool.

WaterDawg Outdoors is a fishing, camping and outdoors supply store located in Hinton, where three rivers meet. Be prepared for your next adventure by stocking up on the latest adventure gear. Kayaks and raft rentals are also available to explore the waters of Almost Heaven.
tags: Fishing, RV and Camping, Watersports, Shopping, Campsites

description: Watoga is a year-round destination. Spring through winter, visitors love Watoga, West Virginia's largest state park. With 10,000 acres of land, Watoga offers many recreational opportunities including hiking, swimming, boating, fishing, camping and geocaching. Vacation cabins are available for rent year-round, while Classic and Legacy cabins are seasonal by nature. There are 34 cabins at Watoga State Park, all with electric hookups. Riverside Campground at Watoga State Park is open in April into October. Beaver Creek Campground with 38 sites and is open from Memorial Day weekend until the last day of deer season (rifle). Laurel Run Campground has 12 primitive sites. Hiking, views, and a history museum are calling cards for this destination. Greenbrier River Trail is easily accessed at Watoga State Park. The park website offers hiking trail information, rates, and operational hours.
address: 4800 Watoga Park Rd, Marlinton, WV 24954, USA
tags: Fishing, Hiking, RV and Camping, History & Heritage, Cabins and Vacation Rentals, Campsites

description: The heritage of early West Virginia is preserved in the pioneer homestead restoration at Watters Smith State Park. The late 1700s farm of Watters Smith includes a log cabin, similar to the original farm that was moved and reconstructed on the park, the Smith family home (c.1876) has been restored as a museum, and an additional museum houses many early farm artifacts. The website link below, includes nature journal, park map and location narrative. State park websites also include event links.
address: 831 Duck Creek Rd, Lost Creek, WV 26385, USA

description: Weathered Ground Brewery serves up craft beer, tasty dishes and warm smiles at this southern West Virginia brewery. Try the Cool Ridge Lager, one of Weathered Ground Brewery’s flagship brands. This Pale Lager is brewed to have a refreshing and crisp flavor. Or quench your thirst with Haggard, an IPA brewed with heaps of late addition El Dorado hops.
address: 2027 Flat Top Rd, Ghent, WV 25843, USA

company: West Virginia Adventures Rafting and Campground
description: West Virginia Adventures Rafting and Campground is located in the lush green area of river rafting country of wild and wonderful West Virginia. It hosts the river rafting rapids of the Lower New River's Class II - V rapids along with the Upper New River's Class II – III for young families. In addition, we offer raft trips on the world-famous Gauley River's Class IV+ rapids. The campground has tent camping with fire pits, a cabin (Two bed, one bath), and RV sites with hook ups, all of which is nestled into a lovely wooded environment. Heated bathrooms with free hot showers are provided. The staff is family oriented and here to provide you with a relaxing yet adventurous visit. Our base camp is centrally located on US Rt 19, just 7 miles north of Beckley, WV and Highway I-64 and I-77.
address: 231 Wood Mountain Rd, Glen Jean, WV 25846, USA
tags: RV and Camping, Whitewater rafting, Cabins and Vacation Rentals, Campsites

description: The West Virginia Botanic Garden (WVBG) is the only botanic garden in the state, and it is open daily from dawn to dusk, free of charge. Maps and other information are available at the kiosk by the lower parking lot. The WVBG offers an extensive program of walks and workshops. Leashed pets are welcome. Bicycles, hunting, fishing, camping, overnight parking, alcohol, horses, fires, vehicles, and removal of plants or animals are not allowed. Visit wvbg.org for more information.

West Virginia Independence Hall, a National Historic Landmark and the birthplace of West Virginia, is located in Wheeling, West Virginia. Originally built as a federal custom house in 1859, it is considered the birthplace of West Virginia because it was the site of a series of events leading up to the state's creation. The building has been lovingly restored with period rooms and exhibitions which interpret the historic and architectural significance of the site. Parking is available behind the building. Tours of the Museum are free.

Your one stop shop to everything you need to know to enjoy winter in almost heaven. Stay up to date on the latest snow reports and check for news about West Virginia’s resorts. With five major ski resorts – Canaan Valley, Oglebay, Snowshoe Mountain, Timberline Four Seasons, and Winterplace – you can find excellent slopes all over the state.
address: 124 Barrington Dr, Scott Depot, WV 25560, USA

description: Information and reservations for touring the WV State Capitol Complex: Hours: Guided tours 9:30am - 3:30pm Monday thru Friday. Tours last approximately 30 minutes. Saturdays 1pm - 4pm on the hour. (Summer hours may vary. Please call for a reservation.) Tours of the Governor’s Mansion require reservations and are scheduled on a first come, first served basis. These tours begin at the Tours and Information Desk at the Lower Rotunda of the State Capitol Building. Tours are offered on Thursdays and Fridays, starting at 9 a.m. with the last tour scheduled for 11:30 a.m. Please call Tour Supervisor Mary Ann Long at 304-558-4839 for reservations and information.
address: Capitol Complex, Building 9, 1900 Kanawha Blvd E, Charleston, WV 25305, USA

description: There’s no better place for non-stop West Virginia gaming action than Wheeling Island Hotel-Casino-Racetrack. Equipped with the best slots, table games, world class hotel accommodations live entertainment and live Greyhound racing, making it your best bet for a gaming getaway. The Wheeling Island Players Club even enables you to earn points and rewards regardless of how you choose to play. So, plan your weekend at Wheeling Island today. Your greatest gaming adventure awaits you!
address: 1 S Stone St, Wheeling, WV 26003, USA

company: Whisper Mountain Campground, RV Park & Log Cabins
description: Whisper Mountain Camp Ground and RV Park is open year around and offers seventy (70) acres of beautiful woods for you to camp and explore. We also have leveled sites, tables, fire circles, hot showers and modern restroom facilities, laundry, swiming pool, sporting area, fishing, hiking trails, a playground for the kiddos and a 200 person picnic pavilion that can be rented for banquets, family gatherings or reunions. We have available 20, 30 and 50 amp electric services along with waste connections. Camping rates depend upon your choice of hookup. When calling after hours, use 681-495-4641 or 681-533-3396. Facilities include log cabins. These cozy one room cabins sleep four. Great for a weekend getaway or use during hunting seasons.
tags: RV and Camping, Cabins and Vacation Rentals, Campsites

company: Whispering Springs Haven Appalachian Mountain Retreat & Private Wildlife Refuge
description: It’s a place where bluebirds fly; hummingbirds find replenishment and whitetail deer find refuge beneath silky dogwoods. It’s a place created for those who seek remote seclusion within the tranquility of awe-inspiring natural beauty. Here, a moment in time is time expanded – to disconnect from every day life, and reconnect to source, to self, to each other.™️ Nestled within a beautiful remote valley at the head of a hollow, at the headwaters of Coon Creek, guests find peace, privacy and seclusion within Whispering Springs Haven’s 102acre private wildlife refuge. Perfect for romantic getaways, family “us time”, artists, musicians & nature lovers seeking simplicity and casual luxury void of distractions. Explore the wildlife habitat pond, cool mountain spring waterfalls and sitting pools. Hike private low impact trails to Coon Knob’s mountaintop vista. Wildlife habitats surround the “Hummingbird House”, a smoke-free cabin/chalet style guesthouse filled with natural light & cool mountain breezes. Every room has a view. Thoughtfully appointed fully equipped amenities designed with all your needs in mind, create the ultimate retreat experience conducive to relaxation, rejuvenation, quiet contemplation, creativity and fun. Soak in an aromatherapy Jacuzzi spa bath; sink into quality bedding within the sounds of silence. View wildlife up-close from the screen porch or wrap-around decks in the morning light or moonlight. Witness raptors soaring and breathtaking stargazing. Read a book or write one. Create art “plein-air” or within well-equipped art and craft studios. Enjoy a large diverse reading, movie and music library. Kids love the children’s creative activity corner. Designed to sleep 1-10 persons comfortably, Whispering Springs Haven offers private vacation rentals, family/friend reunions, couple getaways and honeymoon retreat packages. Private custom or small group scheduled retreats featuring your choice of fine arts, crafts or music lessons, therapeutic spa services, nature studies and conservation stewardship field study programs are provided by Whispering Springs Haven and its talented certified licensed and insured business partnerships. Whispering Springs Haven is far enough away; yet close enough for guests to be in the middle of it all – Frametown Bridge Elk River Water Trail canoeing and kayaking access site is just 4 miles away. Sutton Lake and Burnsville Lake beaches and marinas are within minutes. Enjoy the small-town hospitality of Gassaway and Historic Sutton shops, dining, events, and live performances at Landmark Studio for the Arts, and Braxton County Jamboree. Packages are available. Nearby Attractions: Majestic mountain vistas, whitewater rapids, treetop zip lining, a cultural arts center, WV’s largest lake, a newly designated national park and more; offering memorable recreational opportunities for all ages. Take I-79, Exit 57 onto RT19 Summersville/Beckley. Attractions begin at Summersville Lake, 45 minutes away; New River Gorge National Park and Preserve within 1½ hours. 5-Star Guest Rated • Three Private Suites ADA Compliant • Wi-Fi Visitors by Advanced Reservations Only 4x4/AWD Vehicles Recommended
address: Off I-79, Exit 51, Coon Creek, Frametown, WV 26623, USA

description: Cross Country skiing and snowshoeing are fun, easy to learn, inexpensive, and healthy ways to spend some of your free winter time. Since '79 we have taken pride in our wholesome natural foods cafe, unique laid-back atmosphere, curvy exciting trails, and backcountry ski specialty shop. Our day lodge provides close access to some of West Virginia's most treasured high country. Located in a snowy corner of the Cabin Mountain range of West Virginia's High Alleghenies, we pick up much of our 160" annual snowfall off the Great Lakes whenever strong northwesterly winds drop out of Canada. Originally built as the Weiss Knob Ski Area in 1959, Bob and Anita Barton operated 4 rope tows and had snow making here. We now maintain 50 km of trails -- all ranging from 3200 ft to 4400 ft. Over 1,200 vertical feet to cross country up and over! Open December – March to feed hungry skiers, White Grass Cafe serves homemade hearty soups, sandwiches, cookies, cakes and pies for lunch and offers international specialties from around the world for dinner. The cuisine has produced two popular cookbooks that complement this varied and highly popular winter cafe.
address: White Grass Ski Day Lodge, 643 Weiss Knob Ski Rd, Davis, WV 26260, USA

description: Offering tent and RV camping in West Virginia's beautiful Pocahontas County. Twelve sights ready for tents and fun! On site amenities include water, electric, cooking grill. laundromat, car wash, restroom and shower as well as free internet access... White Oak Village is located minutes away from popular West Virginia attractions such as Snowshoe Mountain Resort, Cass Scenic Railroad, the Greenbrier River Trail, and the National Radio Astronomy Observatory (NRAO) in Greenbank.

company: White Pines Estate Bed and Breakfast L.L.C.
description: We welcome you to our home nestled on a 65 acre estate with mountain views in the lovely town of Berkeley Springs, West Virginia. Our mission is to provide an outstanding experience for our guests from arrival to departure. In a friendly atmosphere we offer well appointed rooms, a smoke free environment, delicious food, and an atmosphere that encourages leisure and a release of stressful thoughts. We go the extra mile to be as helpful as possible to each guest. It is important to us that each guest have a real sense of our hospitality, warmth and generosity. ​ All four guest rooms at White Pines Estate Bed and Breakfast have: *Beautiful mountain views. *Queen sized beds. *Tempur-pedic pillows. *A clock radio and hair dryer. *Private baths with complementary shampoo, conditioner, and body wash. *Our Bed and Breakfast is centrally airconditioned and geo-thermally heated. *Free Wireless High Speed Internet (WIFI). Whether here for a refreshing retreat, romantic stay, or family get together you will find this is a wonderful place to be rejuvinated from the hustle and bustle of everyday life. Activities: *Relax on one our many decks while enoying a pot of fresh brewed organic tea from our on-site Ellen's Tea Room. *Take a walk on our property and gaze up at the treetops. Watch the many birds and wildlife. *Hunt for fossils by the creek. *Observe the endless stars that fill the sky at night. *You'll love the peace you find here. Offsite, explore the town of Berkeley Springs, the mineral baths, massages, the shops, the restaurants, and the many activities such as summer concerts in the park. Spend the day at Cacapon State Park and lake for a day of swimming, hiking, golf, fishing, paddle boating, and horseback riding. During the winter months, Whitetail Ski Resort is not far, offering sking and snowtubing.
address: 3511 Winchester Grade Rd, Berkeley Springs, WV 25411, USA

description: We have over 100 sites with the majority of them having full hook up. The majority of our sites has electric, water, fireplaces, firewood, and picnic tables. We do not offer any type of recreational activities as far as a pool, playground, or sports. From our campground you have access to hiking, bike riding, or swimming in the Greenbrier River which is located 2 miles from us. We also rent out campers and have group rates upon request.

Wilderness Ridge Farm - Cabin Rental - Lodging DRIVING DIRECTIONS: US Rt. 35 N. from Charleston, left onto Cornstalk Road, 3 miles to Cornstalk Lake, turn left, 3.5 miles to Wilderness Ridge Farm on right. US Rt. 35 S. from Point Pleasant, right onto Cornstalk Road, 3 miles to Cornstalk Lake, turn left, 3.5 miles to Wilderness Ridge Farm on right. LODGE: Located on the ridge top, 1,250 sq.ft. private, single family log lodge, fully furnished, sleeps (5) more on the floor. Sleeping loft has cathedral ceiling and upper balcony. Kitchen has rear deck for enjoying the heavily wooded views. Designed and built exclusively for vacation getaway. Back of lodge overlooks fishing pond, woods and family farm. Surrounded by 11,000 acre Chief Cornstalk Wild Game Reserve, wilderness on 3 sides. WILLIAMSBURG SUITE: Located at the rear of main house (2) bedroom suite with shared bath. Outside entrance, formally decorated with king and queen beds, 2nd story deck off large bedroom with fireplace, complimentary breakfast included. ACTIVITIES: hiking, fishing, hunting, bird watching and star gazing as well as "meet the farm residents" for children and other seasonal events. AMENITIES: All lodging includes outdoor porches or decks, gazebo at fishing pond with seasonal paddlewheel boat.
tags: Fishing, Hiking, Hunting and Shooting Sports, Cabins and Vacation Rentals

We also offer free parking, a 24/7 market, barbeque grills, and dry cleaning service. description: The first burial in what is now Woodlawn Cemetery was April 15,1875. Young Joseph Hamilton was found shot with his gun beside him. He was in the old sheep yard on the Elmus and Louisa Hamilton (early Marion County pioneers) property, the part of Middletown, now Fairmont, called Woodlawn today. With over 11,000 graves today, Woodlawn is the resting place of many of the people who helped make Fairmont, Marion County, West Virginia and the nation. Prominent interments include: Francis & Julia Pierpont, Thomas & Annie Fleming, Matthew M. Neely, James O. Watson, Aretas B. Fleming, Boaz Fleming and Peter Miller.

Enjoy the challenge and natural scenic beauty. Woodridge Golf Club offers one of the most unique layouts in the area with a links style 18-hole championship course with Bermuda fairways and Pennlinks bent grass greens.

description: This is the only golf course located in the city of Parkersburg. It is a popular 18-hole public golf facility that has served the area for nearly 75 years. Located just two miles off I-77, exit 176. The course has a flat terrain, easy to walk & wide, tree lined fairways. There are paved concrete cart paths with a fleet of 75 carts with roofs and windshields. The course is close to hotels and restaurants. It has forward tees, slope 107 (4,967 yards), middle tees, slope 103 (5,863 yards) & back tees, slope 108 (6,106 yards). Soft spikes are permitted on golf shoes. Club Key, Golf Card, and W.Va. VIP Cards are honored.

description: A popular preserve in Berkeley County, Yankauer Preserve is a blend of oak forests surrounded by glades of red cedar and dense thickets of fast-growing shrubs and trees. As you move into the center of the property you find a more mature forest of large oaks and maples growing amid limestone outcrops and sinkholes. The eastern edge of the property is a bluff overlooking the Potomac River. The mixed habitat makes the area ideal for birding. The preserve is a hot spot for Spring wildflower displays, as well as sighting warblers on migration. At least 105 species of plants have been identified on the Preserve. Clusters of wildflowers such as Dutchmen's Breeches, Jack-in-the-Pulpit, Hepatica, and Twinleaf are easily found in the spring. The autumn fruits of Paw Paw trees provide a snack for wild animals and not-so-wild hikers alike. There is equal diversity among the animals on the Preserve. Spring migration of waterfowl can be spectacular along the river. Breeding season welcomes sweet-singing warblers and vireos as they nest among the cedars. Barred Owls are often heard as they cry out in search for a mate. Three well marked trails take the visitor through a variety of habitat types on the preserve. The "Kingfisher Trail," a "South Trail," and "Dan Fisher Trail" all loop, and one can walk a large circle across the property. A trail brochure is available on site. The preserve is jointly managed by The Nature Conservancy and The Potomac Valley Audubon Society.
address: 438 Whitings Neck Rd, Martinsburg, WV 25404, USA

description: Ye Olde Alpha Restaurant, established in 1932, is a family owned and operated Restaurant and Lounge serving only fine, quality food and all legal beverages in a friendly, neighborhood atmosphere. A wide range of menu selections are available from Breakfast- any time- to Prime steaks and fresh seafood. Private Party rooms are available. Dining hours are daily from 11:00 am to Midnight.

This charming, three-bedroom cottage is located on the Staunton-to-Parkersburg Turnpike in Bartow, WV. Yeager House sits in a valley surrounded by the Allegheny Mountains and the Monongahela National Forest. The house is located on the site of the Civil War Battle of the Greenbrier River (1861) and provides easy access to hiking and biking trails, close to Snowshoe Resort and the Green Bank Observatory. Whether you are a Civil War buff or just enjoy the outdoors, Yeager House is your gateway to adventure. The house sleeps six--three bedrooms one bath. It is fully furnished and all amenities are provided: linens, paper products, hair dryer, washer & dryer, iron and ironing board, AC and WiFi. There is a fully equipped kitchen including microwave, toaster oven, and coffee maker with filters. For your relaxation there is a TV (no cable) and DVD player, magazines, books and games. The patio has table and chairs and a charcoal grill, with charcoal provided.​​
address: 49 Old Pike Rd, Bartow, WV 24920, USA

description: Small, unique family owned and operated shop. It features a wide assortment of collectors glass including: Fenton, Imperial, Blenko, etc. In addition, there are primitive items, furniture and it specializes in a large assortment of coins.

The Yew Mountain Center is a new experiential education non-profit in Pocahontas County offering family friendly learning weekends, field trips, and special events based on the rich ecology and culture of the area. The 500 acre property has mature forests, spring-fed ponds, well-developed trails and a rustic lodge. 450 of the acres are maturing upland hardwood forest with several miles of trails. About 50 acres are in pasture, old fields and ponds. The closest pond to the lodge is great for swimming, fishing and canoeing. Our lodge features a central great room with stone fireplace, a commercial kitchen, a dining/meeting room and six guest rooms, each with a private bath. There is a large deck on the eastern side of the building and a covered porch on the west. We also offer B&B style lodging as our schedule allows.

Visitors to Pendleton County, who would like to take in the breathtaking vista from atop Seneca Rocks, can do so without the exertion of climbing the trail to the top. Go by horse and enjoy a leisurely ride. Our gentle, well-trained, sturdy horses will carry you there and back. First-time riders are no problem. Experienced guides go with you on every ride. The trail is a gradual scenic climb, and parents can be assured that children six and up will find the adventure an experience to treasure.
address: PO Box 24, Seneca Rocks, WV 26884, USA

description: The only lodging located right in the heart of Seneca Rocks, West Virginia, Yokum’s Vacationland has a wide array of accommodations with tent camping, teepee camping, RV camping, fully-equipped cabins with hot tubs, motel rooms and 2 apartments. There is a general store with a deli and riverside parking with hookups for campers and motor homes. Yokum’s Vacationland has two beautiful campgrounds with views of Seneca Rocks. Tent camping and full RV hook-ups are available at both. We do not take reservations for camping. Sites are first come first serve. Lower Campground is nestled along the North Fork of the South Branch of the Potomac River. There are 15 full hook-up RV sites and 10 water/electric hook-ups along the river and throughout the campground, a playground set for children, and a bathhouse with bathrooms and showers. There is also a dump station in this campground. Tent camping is also possible in this campground, and there is a pavilion open to use and available for rent for group events. The Princess Snowbird Campground is located just across the road from Seneca Rocks. It borders Seneca Creek on one side and a cow pasture/mountain on the other. In addition to tent camping, there are 10 full hook-up RV sites and 15 sites with water/electric hookup only, both along the river and throughout the campground. The Princess Snowbird Cabins are also found in this campground, as well as the teepees, bunkhouses, 2 bathhouses with showers and toilets, and 2 pavilions. The 11 motel room are located above the store. All rooms have a kitchenette, and most have a great view of the rocks. We have 14 cabins from simple hunter's cabins to honeymoon cabins with jacuzzis, or log cabins with hot tubs. Yokum's store has just about anything you could possibly need on your trip to the mountains...groceries, camping gear, automotive, and of course souvenirs! The deli, located in the store, is open 7 days a week for breakfast, lunch, and dinner.
address: 23787 Mountaineer Dr, Seneca Rocks, WV 26884, USA

description: The Youth Museum of Southern West Virginia is just steps away from the Beckley Exhibition Coal Mine. Plan to visit their Pioneer Village and Mountain Homestead. The Youth Museum is open year-round and offers changing interactive exhibits on art, history, science and nature.

The historical Zopher D. Ramsdell House, the first brick home built in Ceredo, sets along the banks of the Ohio River and is said to have helped hide slaves on the Underground Railroad. The Ramsdells were strict Quakers and abolitionists and maintained historic documents and artifacts. On the National Register of Historic Places. Visitors may tour the house Sundays, from 2-4 p.m., except holidays.
address: 1108 B St Box 691, Ceredo, WV 25507, USA

description: ZenClay's is a place unique to Morgantown. the Cafe was established in 2001 and offers great food with a focus on local foods, a healthier lifestyle, and a great environment where you share your meals with art and music. There is a great staff who offer the best possible experience. . ZenClay's Studio was establish in 1999. Since then they have taught many classes and provided the opportunity for people who wish to learn about making pottery, ceramic objects, and many other aspects of art. ZenClay strives to provide the greater Morgantown area with a place to learn and enrich their lives with art.
